Title: Cloud Software Engineer (m/f/x) in Stuttgart
Description:
You make the difference. Whether in business Audit & Assurance, Risk Advisory, Tax & Legal, Financial Advisory or Consulting: at Deloitte, we help our global clients continuously evolve. Discover a diverse working environment that is constantly in motion and always revolving around one central hub: you and your expertise. What impact will you make?

Do you want to leverage the full power of the cloud for our clients in Consulting – Cloud Transformation & System Engineering? Our teams guide businesses on their cloud journeys, from strategizing to developing and integrating high-performing, future-proof applications, as well as transforming major IT divisions into agile entities, moving complex IT landscapes to the cloud, and operating innovative software services. Ensure our joint success and make the difference with us as a Cloud Software Engineer (m/f/x).

Locations: Berlin, Cologne, Dusseldorf, Frankfurt, Hamburg, Hanover, Leipzig, Munich and Stuttgart.

Your impact:

As a Cloud Software Engineer (m/f/x) your role will be to support IT transformation and software delivery projects from conception phase to production by developing advanced solutions. You will work collaboratively with other experts in the team to generate value for our clients.


Adaptable architectures: Design flexible architectures in an agile environment which are compliant with clean code and software craftsmanship standards.
Best practices: Develop best practices for testability, maintainability, scalability, and other areas to support an open team culture.
Technical support: Assist internal teams as well as clients with the assessment of technologies to be used.
Community: Step up and make your contribution, for example by actively taking part in conferences and meet-ups.


Your skillset:


Bachelor’s or master’s degree, or Austrian HTL degree, ideally IT-focused (e.g. (business) informatics, mathematics, or physics), or equivalent education/training/experience
Experience in programming, software development in a cloud environment (AWS, Azure or GCP), implementing cloud infrastructure solutions (e.g. Terraform) or containerization (e.g. Docker or Kubernetes)
Hands-on in continuous integration and deployment (e.g. Git, GitHub Actions or Jenkins), and nice to have knowledge in machine learning libaries and NLP
Analytical and structured, team-oriented and capable of responding to complex client inquiries in a structured and organized manner
Fluent English and German (B2) language, both written and spoken and willing to travel occasionally


Your chance:


Best-in-class ongoing education at Deloitte University and through individual qualification programs and training sessions
Extensive professional development opportunities with structured career planning, inclusive leadership, secondment programs, project-based job rotation, and support for societal engagement and corporate volunteering
Work-family balance with a family advice service, mobile working, part-time hours, sabbaticals, support for family caregivers, counseling for parental leave, and much more
A focus on health and fitness with regular health-themed days, partnerships with fitness providers, and support for sporting and team events
Attractive employer benefits including bicycle and car leasing, a company smartphone for private use, and flexible working models (such as trust-based working hours and EU remote working)
Plenty of scope for creativity and active promotion of an inclusive corporate culture – for instance through our diversity and inclusion employee networks


Are you ready? Make a difference with us!

Our recruiting team looks forward to receiving your application documents (CV as well as general qualification for university entrance, university and work references) via our online form. A cover letter and an application photo are not required.

Equal opportunities for all: We look forward to receiving applications from people who are as diverse as we are – irrespective of age, disability, ethnic origin and nationality, gender, religion, sexual identity or social background. Any questions? You can find all the information you need about our application process in our application FAQs.

Job-ID: 46515


Show more
HTML:
You make the difference. Whether in business Audit & Assurance, Risk Advisory, Tax & Legal, Financial Advisory or Consulting: at Deloitte, we help our global clients continuously evolve. Discover a diverse working environment that is constantly in motion and always revolving around one central hub: you and your expertise. What impact will you make?

Do you want to leverage the full power of the cloud for our clients in Consulting – Cloud Transformation & System Engineering? Our teams guide businesses on their cloud journeys, from strategizing to developing and integrating high-performing, future-proof applications, as well as transforming major IT divisions into agile entities, moving complex IT landscapes to the cloud, and operating innovative software services. Ensure our joint success and make the difference with us as a Cloud Software Engineer (m/f/x).

Locations: Berlin, Cologne, Dusseldorf, Frankfurt, Hamburg, Hanover, Leipzig, Munich and Stuttgart.

Your impact:

As a Cloud Software Engineer (m/f/x) your role will be to support IT transformation and software delivery projects from conception phase to production by developing advanced solutions. You will work collaboratively with other experts in the team to generate value for our clients.

  • Adaptable architectures: Design flexible architectures in an agile environment which are compliant with clean code and software craftsmanship standards.
  • Best practices: Develop best practices for testability, maintainability, scalability, and other areas to support an open team culture.
  • Technical support: Assist internal teams as well as clients with the assessment of technologies to be used.
  • Community: Step up and make your contribution, for example by actively taking part in conferences and meet-ups.

Your skillset:

  • Bachelor’s or master’s degree, or Austrian HTL degree, ideally IT-focused (e.g. (business) informatics, mathematics, or physics), or equivalent education/training/experience
  • Experience in programming, software development in a cloud environment (AWS, Azure or GCP), implementing cloud infrastructure solutions (e.g. Terraform) or containerization (e.g. Docker or Kubernetes)
  • Hands-on in continuous integration and deployment (e.g. Git, GitHub Actions or Jenkins), and nice to have knowledge in machine learning libaries and NLP
  • Analytical and structured, team-oriented and capable of responding to complex client inquiries in a structured and organized manner
  • Fluent English and German (B2) language, both written and spoken and willing to travel occasionally

Your chance:

  • Best-in-class ongoing education at Deloitte University and through individual qualification programs and training sessions
  • Extensive professional development opportunities with structured career planning, inclusive leadership, secondment programs, project-based job rotation, and support for societal engagement and corporate volunteering
  • Work-family balance with a family advice service, mobile working, part-time hours, sabbaticals, support for family caregivers, counseling for parental leave, and much more
  • A focus on health and fitness with regular health-themed days, partnerships with fitness providers, and support for sporting and team events
  • Attractive employer benefits including bicycle and car leasing, a company smartphone for private use, and flexible working models (such as trust-based working hours and EU remote working)
  • Plenty of scope for creativity and active promotion of an inclusive corporate culture – for instance through our diversity and inclusion employee networks

Are you ready? Make a difference with us!

Our recruiting team looks forward to receiving your application documents (CV as well as general qualification for university entrance, university and work references) via our online form. A cover letter and an application photo are not required.

Equal opportunities for all: We look forward to receiving applications from people who are as diverse as we are – irrespective of age, disability, ethnic origin and nationality, gender, religion, sexual identity or social background. Any questions? You can find all the information you need about our application process in our application FAQs.

Job-ID: 46515

Title: Data Scientist (Analytics), New Verticals
Description:
Job Description

About the New Verticals Group

The New Verticals Group is all about expanding Wolt beyond Restaurants and helping deliver anything our Customers want with unprecedented convenience and world-leading customer experience. We want to make Wolt, the best place to order groceries, convenience, pharmacy, electronics, home, pet stores, clothing, and other retail goods. Our vision is to make Wolt the world’s best shopping mall, in your pocket.

We work closely together with cross-functional teams to ensure that we have solid organic and inorganic growth plans, that we execute those perfectly in our country operations, and disseminate best practices across the organization to reduce the growth pains of rapid scaling (it always hurts when you grow >2x per year!) 🚀

About The New Verticals Analytics Team

Our New Verticals Analytics team sits at the intersection of product development, strategic planning, and operational execution. We partner with Product, Engineering, Design, and Operations teams to guide measurement and tactical decision-making using advanced analytics as we expand the Wolt platform across the globe.

You’ll be part of this team working with top Data Science and Analytics Engineering professionals.

About The Role

As a Data Scientist at Wolt, your role involves diving into our data to solve crucial business problems. The scope of this role ranges from diagnosing problem areas to identifying solutions, to designing experiments and ultimately influencing decision-making. This is a rare, operational, and actionable data-driven experience that combines scientific expertise with stakeholder engagement. When you join this team, you will be taking ownership of the business outcomes.

If you enjoy finding patterns amidst the chaos, are excited to build from the ground up, and have experience using data science skills to solve business problems, we want you on our team.

Our offering to you


The online delivery platform that Wolt is building will offer you interesting and complex challenges together with the opportunities to create a big impact with your skills. Lots of geolocational and temporal data in real-time combined with differences in the economics and dynamics of the cities we operate in make Wolt both a challenging and so interesting company to practice analytics.
You can choose the location from our tech hubs Helsinki, Berlin and Stockholm, or you can work entirely remotely anywhere in Finland, Germany, Sweden and Estonia. You have the chance to decide the ways of working — a hybrid, at the office, or remote within the location above. 💙 Read more about our remote setup.
You would get to work in a company culture where we take ownership beyond the obvious, do common things uncommonly well, we think big but stay humble, do right by people, we treat others kindly and justly, recognize that if we don’t learn, we won’t stay still but fall behind and keep in mind that Luke was Yoda’s greatest achievement. Read more about how we work.


Our humble expectations


Degree in Mathematics, Statistics, Computer Science, or a related field.
4+ years of experience in a Data Analytics or Data Science position.
Expertise in statistical analysis using statistical software packages in Python or R.
Expertise in causal inference (Diff in Diff, Synthetic control).
Proficiency in writing structured and efficient SQL queries for large data sets.
Prior experience building intuitive data visualizations and dashboards that influence business decisions, utilizing tools like Looker, Tableau, Mixpanel, or similar.
Relentless pursuit of new ideas and data sources, and have the ability to systematically tackle ambiguous problems with a data-driven, hypothesis-based approach.


Next Steps

The position will be filled as soon as we find the right person, so make sure to apply as soon as you realize you really, really want to join us!

The compensation will be a negotiable combination of monthly pay and DoorDash RSUs. The latter makes it exceptionally easy to be excited about our company growing and doing well, as you’ll own a piece of the pie.

For any further questions about the position, you can turn to Product+ Talent Acquisition Partner - Zhanna Filintseva (zhanna.filintseva@wolt.com)

About Wolt

Wolt is a technology company that makes it incredibly easy to discover and get the best restaurants, grocery stores and other local shops delivered to your home or office. Wolt is not just a delivery app – we’re a technology company building a commerce platform to seamlessly connect our millions of customers with thousands of merchant and courier partners, in real-time across 23 countries and 250+ cities. Our apps (iOS and Android) have the industry’s highest ratings, largely thanks to our customer-first-mindset, which shows in how we build products and run operations. In June 2022 we officially joined forces with DoorDash. Combined, we have a presence in 27 countries, 23 of which operate with the Wolt brand and app. Wolt and DoorDash continue largely independently, with Wolt’s name, brand, product, technology and team.

Working in Product Development at Wolt

At Wolt, we’re about getting things done. You’ll probably enjoy it here if you like taking ownership, developing yourself and being around friendly, humble and ambitious people.

The behind the scenes of Wolt is run by an awesome bunch of over 400+ planners, builders, designers and data crunchers. We call ourselves Product+, as we’re the very core of Wolt’s products, tools and platforms. To build our products, we work in over 40 cross-functional, independent and autonomous teams. Teams are made up of a mix of talented individuals: engineers, designers, data scientists, analysts, and product leads. Each team takes ownership for solving customer problems in the best possible way.

Our Commitment to Diversity, Equity & Inclusion

We want to have all sorts of people in our team – people like you and me, and people different from you and me. To be able to work with diverse teammates – when it comes to gender, age, ethnicity, life background, sexual orientation, political views, religion, or any other personal trait – we consciously aim to offer equal opportunity for everyone to work with us. This is because we believe diverse teams make the most thought-through decisions and build things in the most inclusive way.

Join us today to build Wolt together!

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
My client is looking for a Data Scientist who has a real interest in a more programming heavy role, to join their vibrant team in their sleek Stockholm office.

The company's main focus is working alongside businesses (small, medium and enterprise) to ensure that they are maximising their business operations; this includes anything from auditing, payroll to VAT accounting, declaration or business acquisition.

They are now looking to build their impactful technology dept with a Data Scientist.

Responsibilities


Enhance MLOps environment: Continuously improve the machine learning operations (MLOps) environment to streamline model deployment and monitoring processes.
Work with Large Language Models (LLMs): Develop and optimize models using large language models to meet various project requirements.
Deploy ML models to production: Manage the end-to-end deployment of machine learning models, ensuring they are robust, scalable, and efficient in production.
Collaborate with internal teams: Partner with internal business teams to understand their needs and provide data-driven solutions.
Engage with portfolio companies: Work closely with companies within the portfolio to deliver machine learning solutions that address specific business challenges and opportunities.


Qualifications


Minimum of 2 years working as a Data Scientist or a Software/Data Engineer who's worked with building ML algorithms
2 years engineering experience with Python
Confident working with cloud and most preferably Azure - their tech stack includes Form Recognizer, Cognitive Search, Storage and others
Worked with supervising models in production
Familiar with a MLOps enviro, supervising models in productions and LLMs
It's beneficial if you've previously deployed unsupervised and supervised ML models to production
BSc/MSc in a relevant field
Fluency in Swedish and English


As a Data Scientist, you will get a lot of trust to do your own thing and take on a huge amount of responsibility where you can make a lot of your own solutions and have full control over the Data Science strategy.

This is a great opportunity if you're somebody who loves having a broad role in an environment that encourages you to grow and learn new things, while working with modern tech.

Interested in finding out more? Apply with your updated CV.
Show more

Title: AI or ML Engineer
Description:
Are you looking for a role within an exciting world of AI technologies, where you can both contribute to the project with your expertise and keep on learning?

We are starting a new chapter within ASSA ABLOY’s organization, and we are looking for top talent to help us grow our AI Technical Development Teams from scratch.

Join our Team in Stockholm, Sweden and enjoy a collaborative culture that empowers you to build a career you can be proud of.

What would you do as our AI or ML Engineer

We are looking for an AI generalist to join our brand new project related to AI Technical Development, together with our newly created Team of Engineers, based in Stockholm.

We work in cross-functional teams, responsible for developing modern, secure and top-quality solutions. We develop embedded applications and integrate them with Mobile Applications, Electronic Access Control software using cloud and microservice architecture.

You would also:


Stay up-to-date with the latest AI technologies.
Be responsible for ML and GenAI development processes.
Perform data preparation, validation, cleaning, testing.
Be responsible for model training, deployment, tracking.


The Skills And Experience You Need

We are looking for someone who:


has previous experienced as an AI or ML engineer, including building data pipelines, training models or developing Gen AI LLM based apps and deploying them safely to production.
has hands-on experience with MLOps and training modern ML models.
is experienced in LLMs and other models, Gen AI and ‘Chatbots’.
is experienced in Python, Jupyter, TensorFlow/PyTorch.
has knowledge of Cloud infrastructure, data bases, CI/CD.
is fluent in English, spoken and written.


What We Offer

We’re passionate about providing amazing opportunities and benefits, so you can continue and progress a lifelong career with us – here’s what we have to offer:


Learning and career development opportunities, whether it’s online learning, management training or enhancing your skills.
A competitive salary and incentive schemes.
Hybrid model of working.
Flexible working hours.
Stable employment in a friendly international atmosphere.


We review applications regularly, so don’t wait

We are building diverse, inclusive teams, and encourage applications from everyone who can see themselves working with us. Just set up your profile and apply here, no later than 15th Septembe 2024.

To make sure your personal data is safe, we don’t look at any applications sent by email or post. If you have any questions about the role or the process, email Daria Skucha, Talent Acquisition Business Partner, at Daria.Skucha@assaabloy.com.

Let’s create a safer and more open world - together!

To find out more about us, visit www.assaabloy.com

We are the ASSA ABLOY Group

Our people have made us the global leader in access solutions. In return, we open doors for them wherever they go. With nearly 61,000 colleagues in more than 70 different countries, we help billions of people experience a more open world. Our innovations make all sorts of spaces – physical and virtual – safer, more secure, and easier to access.

As an employer, we value results – not titles, or backgrounds. We empower our people to build their career around their aspirations and our ambitions – supporting them with regular feedback, training, and development opportunities. Our colleagues think broadly about where they can make the most impact, and we encourage them to grow their role locally, regionally, or even internationally.

As we welcome new people on board, it’s important to us to have diverse, inclusive teams, and we value different perspectives and experiences.
Show more

Title: Data Scientist - Acceleration Nordics
Description:
Welcome to join an experienced and growing team of Data scientists and Consultants who work to drive increased marketing effectiveness for some of Sweden's and the world's largest brands.

As part of the leading media agency group GroupM, we at Acceleration work to transform large amounts of data into solutions to complex problems in media and marketing. The projects include a broad mix of econometrics, media buying algorithms, dashboards and strategy projects/consulting services.

Acceleration drives GroupM and the rest of the industry forward through technology and data innovation and works closely with the largest advertisers, publishers and technology companies in the industry. This is a position with a plethora of opportunities for growth both professionally and personally.

About The Position

The position includes working in a team with experienced colleagues:


Be a driven data scientist for projects in econometrics, attribution, experiments, algorithms and other data science-related projects
Together with the rest of the project team, analyze, package and present to our customers
Participate in and drive development projects within automated reporting, algorithms and other data science commitments


Professional And Personal Qualifications

We are a team with entrepreneurial drive. Professionally, we believe that you are a recent graduate or have worked for a number of years in data science or analysis with the following skills:


Education with a solid foundation in mathematics and statistics (e.g. MSc in mathematics, industrial economics, alternatively economist or statistician)
Experience with PowerPoint
Experience in project management
Ability to present and communicate your results in a convincing manner
Knowledge of different Excel, R, PowerBI is an advantage (but not a requirement)
Knowledge of applications within Cloud environments is an advantage (but not a requirement)
Knowledge of the ecosystem for digital media and environments within, for example, Google Marketing Platform, Facebook and Xandr is an advantage (but not a requirement)


On a personal level, we believe you are interested in:


Present and communicate your results to relevant stakeholders
Drive dialogues and deliver projects in both Swedish and English
Work thoroughly, detail-oriented and independently (proactive and entrepreneurial)
Be a "team player" with a willingness to work both individually and in a team


Our offer

With us, you get the opportunity to work with many of Sweden's and the world's most ambitious brands, together with a team that is passionate about digital marketing, and with market-leading technologies.

You will sit in central premises on Birger Jarlsgatan with inspiring colleagues from different backgrounds, who together drive digital marketing to the next level through innovation and solid work. Furthermore, there are great opportunities for personal development and career development within GroupM Sweden, as well as within our global network.

We are part of WPP, a large international group, and we work to combine the best of these two worlds. You are offered to work in a stimulating and developing workplace with a high comfort factor and colleagues who are close to laughing.

In addition to the obvious, such as good working conditions, pleasant working environment and exciting challenges, there are a couple of things that make working here a little extra good:


Great participation and opportunity to be involved and influence your daily work
Family spirit, short decision-making paths and great closeness between management and employees
We think that a balance between work, leisure and personal development is important
Wellness allowance of SEK 3,000/year and several attractive staff benefits
We offer market-adapted pension terms and private pension advice via our partner Nordea
We have occupational health care via Feelgood and additional health insurance via Euro Accident
Conferences, kick-offs and other fun that we do together
Office centrally located in the middle of Stockholm city on Birger Jarlsgatan


Application

The position is a full-time permanent position with entry as soon as possible. We apply a six-month probationary period.

In addition to reviewing your resume and conducting interviews, we incorporate a testing phase in our hiring process. Selection and interviews take place continuously, so submit your application with CV and personal letter as soon as possible.

Contact

If you have questions about the position, you are welcome to contact Filip Stjernfeldt, Senior Data Scientist & Team Lead at filip.stjernfeldt@groupm.com. We do not accept applications via e-mail.

About GroupM

GroupM is one of Sweden's largest media agency groups and consists of Wavemaker, EssenceMediacom, Mindshare, Nexus and Acceleration. GroupM's primary goal is to create benefits for our clients through collaborations with the group's agencies. We do this, among other things, through economies of scale in trading, technology and data. We are part of WPP, which is one of the world's largest groups in marketing communications with over 190,000 employees on a global basis. GroupM Sweden has around 375 employees in Stockholm, Gothenburg, and Malmö.
Show more

  • Work thoroughly, detail-oriented and independently (proactive and entrepreneurial)
  • Be a "team player" with a willingness to work both individually and in a team

Our offer

With us, you get the opportunity to work with many of Sweden's and the world's most ambitious brands, together with a team that is passionate about digital marketing, and with market-leading technologies.

You will sit in central premises on Birger Jarlsgatan with inspiring colleagues from different backgrounds, who together drive digital marketing to the next level through innovation and solid work. Furthermore, there are great opportunities for personal development and career development within GroupM Sweden, as well as within our global network.

We are part of WPP, a large international group, and we work to combine the best of these two worlds. You are offered to work in a stimulating and developing workplace with a high comfort factor and colleagues who are close to laughing.

In addition to the obvious, such as good working conditions, pleasant working environment and exciting challenges, there are a couple of things that make working here a little extra good:

  • Great participation and opportunity to be involved and influence your daily work
  • Family spirit, short decision-making paths and great closeness between management and employees
  • We think that a balance between work, leisure and personal development is important
  • Wellness allowance of SEK 3,000/year and several attractive staff benefits
  • We offer market-adapted pension terms and private pension advice via our partner Nordea
  • We have occupational health care via Feelgood and additional health insurance via Euro Accident
  • Conferences, kick-offs and other fun that we do together
  • Office centrally located in the middle of Stockholm city on Birger Jarlsgatan

Application

The position is a full-time permanent position with entry as soon as possible. We apply a six-month probationary period.

In addition to reviewing your resume and conducting interviews, we incorporate a testing phase in our hiring process. Selection and interviews take place continuously, so submit your application with CV and personal letter as soon as possible.

Contact

If you have questions about the position, you are welcome to contact Filip Stjernfeldt, Senior Data Scientist & Team Lead at filip.stjernfeldt@groupm.com. We do not accept applications via e-mail.

About GroupM

GroupM is one of Sweden's largest media agency groups and consists of Wavemaker, EssenceMediacom, Mindshare, Nexus and Acceleration. GroupM's primary goal is to create benefits for our clients through collaborations with the group's agencies. We do this, among other things, through economies of scale in trading, technology and data. We are part of WPP, which is one of the world's largest groups in marketing communications with over 190,000 employees on a global basis. GroupM Sweden has around 375 employees in Stockholm, Gothenburg, and Malmö.

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
The ideal candidate has a track record of having built multiple high-performance, stable, scalable systems that have been successfully shipped to customers in production. Your work and your approach to work are exemplary: you drive best practices and set standards for your team. You are a key influencer in your team’s strategy and contribute significantly to team planning. You show good judgment in making trade-offs between immediate and long-term business needs. You are a collaborative leader that makes other engineers and team members around you more productive, by sharing your knowledge, and helping to tie-break key technical decisions. You provide mentoring to other scientists and engineers.

Start: ASAP

Duration: Min 7-8 months

Location: Mostly remote but must be from Sweden and preferably from Stockholm

The perfect candidate will have a background in a quantitative or technical field, will have experience working with experimentation on large data sets, strong statistics, analytics and will have experience in data-driven decision making and machine learning. You are focused on results, a self-starter, and have demonstrated success in using analytics to drive the understanding, growth, and success of a product.

If you delight in data science and use the latest in AI/ML/RL to help use data to make and drive decisions for hundreds of millions of customers across web, mobile and connected devices, then this is the role

for you.

What To Bring


Expert in Python language.
Expert in Python Notebooks Data Science Libraries (Scipy, Numpy, Pandas, Scikit-learn)
Asynchronous, non-blocking, functional style of programming and experience implementing with Python.
Strong SQL & NoSQL experience and performance tuning.
Expert in Databricks Platform (SQL, Compute, Clusters, ML, Workflows)
Strong DBT (Data Build Tool) experience in building and architecting data pipelines and analytics workflows. Including unit testing and data testing of DBT based SQL & Python models.
Experimentation design and A/B testing
Expert knowledge of statistical analysis. Including P-value, T-Test, Lift calculations for experimentation analysis.
Experience in machine learning and reinforcement learning systems (ML/RL) and building ML models, ML operations and feature engineering. Including related tooling for shared feature stores, release and deployment management.
Experience of Exploit vs Exploration problems and related Bandit algorithms for Experimentation. Including Contextual Multi Armed Bandits, Epsilon-*, Search, Ranking, Markov Chains, Attribution, Decision, Thompson Sampling and other families of algorithms to help solve problems.
Experience working in fields of quantitative analysis, machine learning, modeling, statistics, attribution (Shapley, Markov), research and algorithm development.
Demonstrated ability to work in a highly collaborative way on large scale projects.
Excellent communication skills both written and verbal
Required MS Degree or PHD in Computer Science, Maths, Statistics or equivalent experience
Designing and evaluating experiments, monitoring key product metrics, understanding root causes of changes in metrics
Understanding of causality and its effect on machine learning applications
Collaborate with data and analytics engineers assisting on data work.
Offer enhancements to best practices and documentation.
Building and analyzing dashboards and reports. Looker (Google) dashboard experience would be ideal.
Exploratory Analysis & Research

Title: Junior Machine Learning Engineer till Innovativt Internationellt Team
Description:
Industrin genomgår stora förändringar – omvandlingen till en smart och uppkopplad industri. Gå med i vår kunds internationella team och utveckla innovativa lösningar för hållbar och flexibel industriell produktion för kunder över hela världen.




OM TJÄNSTEN:

Teamet består av 25 personer som jobbar agilt och enligt SAFe-ramverket. Just nu utvecklar de en feature som analyserar moment i verktyg över tid, från lågt till högt moment. Modellen ska kunna identifiera avvikelser och ge förslag på fel i förebyggande syfte, samt ge löpande rekommendationer för att undvika dessa avvikelser. En viktig del av arbetet är att övervaka modellen, samla in feedback och träna om modellen vid behov. Cykeln är således: deploy, monitor, retrain.




ARBETSUPPGIFTER:

Som Machine Learning Engineer blir din uppgift att bygga pipelines för att verifiera att ML-modellen fungerar i produktion. Du kommer att:

Hämta data från kunder och validera samt testa modellen.
Om modellen inte fungerar, arbeta vidare med utvecklingen.
När modellen fungerar bra, gå vidare till nästa steg och deploya.




Du kommer att arbeta som en ML/Ops-ingenjör med fokus på pipelines och utveckling i Python.




VI SÖKER DIG SOM:

Har en teknisk akademisk examen, gärna en Master inom ett relevant område som tillämpad beräkningsvetenskap eller Machine Learning. Du har ett relevant exjobb eller hobbyprojekt att visa upp.
Talar flytande engelska och trivs med att samarbeta både lokalt och globalt.




Som person är du nyfiken, social och flexibel. Du är bra på att kommunicera och samarbeta med andra i din omgivning.




OM KUNDFÖRETAGET:

Vår kund är ett globalt företag specialiserat på industriell teknik och lösningar. De har en lång historia av innovation och är en ledande aktör inom olika branscher, inklusive gruvdrift, anläggningsmaskiner, komprimerad luft och gas samt industriell produktion. Företaget fokuserar på att utveckla och tillverka högkvalitativa produkter och lösningar som är hållbara, effektiva och bidrar till kundernas framgång. Vår kund är känd för sitt starka kundfokus, etiska affärsprinciper och globala närvaro, med verksamhet i olika länder runt om i världen.




OM ANSTÄLLNINGEN:

Detta är ett konsultuppdrag, vilket innebär att du inledningsvis kommer att vara anställd av Friday. Ambitionen från både kundens och vår sida är att du efter 6–12 månader blir direktanställd hos kunden.




ÖVRIG INFO

Omfattning: Heltid
Start: Omgående/September
Placering: Stockholm/Nacka, med hybrid-möjligheter
Rekryteringsansvarig: Mattias Isik
Lön: Marknadsmässig




Ansök genom att klicka på länken nedan. Skicka in din ansökan så snart som möjligt då vi gör löpande urval och annonsen kan stängas ner innan tjänsten är tillsatt om vi går över till urvals- och intervjufasen.




OM FRIDAY

Genom att vara en partner till både våra kandidater och kunder strävar vi efter att hitta den bästa matchningen. Vi lär känna våra kunder och kandidater på riktigt! Förutom att säkerställa att kunskaps- och erfarenhetskrav matchar, lägger vi stor vikt vid samsyn kring värderingar och företagskultur som båda parter värdesätter.

Vår passion är att hjälpa människor till rätt roll, arbetsplats och sammanhang inom IT och teknik. Därför grundade vi Friday med ambition att hjälpa dig till jobbet som ger dig fredagskänslan – varje dag!

Vi riktar oss främst till dig som är i början av din karriär eller studerar vid högskola/universitet inom IT och Teknik.

Vår övertygelse är att människor uppnår sin fulla potential när man ser fram emot att gå till jobbet varje morgon. ”Friday – everyday”, hur låter det?

Show more

Title: Data Scientist, Merchant
Description:
Job Description

About Merchant Group at Wolt

Wolt as a platform focuses on serving three main groups: customers, couriers, and merchants. In a nutshell, the Merchant Group strives to make Wolt an integral part of our Merchant’s daily business. Their core mission is to provide merchants with self-service tools and automation that are useful, efficient, reliable, and delightful to use.

About The Merchant Analytics Team

Merchant Analytics is an embedded analytics function within the Merchant Group. The team works to unlock insights related to the marketplace and turn them into actionable recommendations that drive the success of merchants at Wolt. While keeping merchants at heart, the analytics team focuses on all kinds of analytics projects that can benefit merchants while ensuring a seamless consumer experience and also supporting Wolt’s marketplace strategy.

About The Role

As a Data Scientist at Wolt, your role involves diving into our data to solve crucial business problems. The scope of this role ranges from diagnosing problem areas to identifying solutions to designing experiments and ultimately influencing decision-making. This is a rare, operational, and actionable data-driven experience. When you join this team, you will be driving action from the frontlines, rather than just doing yet another analytics role.

Our offering to you


The online delivery platform that Wolt is building will offer you interesting and complex challenges together with the opportunities to create a big impact with your skills. Lots of geolocational and temporal data in real-time combined with differences in the economics and dynamics of the cities we operate in make Wolt both a challenging and so interesting company to practice analytics.
You can choose the location from our tech hubs Helsinki, Berlin and Stockholm, or you can work entirely remotely anywhere in Finland, Germany, Sweden and Estonia. You have the chance to decide the ways of working — a hybrid, at the office, or remote within the location above. 💙 Read more about our remote setup.
You would get to work in a company culture where we take ownership beyond the obvious, do common things uncommonly well, we think big but stay humble, do right by people, we treat others kindly and justly, recognize that if we don’t learn, we won’t stay still but fall behind and keep in mind that Luke was Yoda’s greatest achievement. Read more about how we work.


Our humble expectations


Degree in Mathematics, Statistics, Computer Science, or a related field, or equivalent work experience.
4+ years of experience in an analytics or data science position within an industry or research setting.
Expertise in statistical analysis, including hypothesis testing, experimentation and causal inference using statistical software packages in Python, R, or equivalent.
Proficiency in writing structured and efficient SQL queries for large data sets.
Have prior experience building intuitive data visualizations and dashboards that influence business decisions, utilizing tools like Tableau, Mixpanel, Looker, or similar.
Relentless pursuit of new ideas and data sources, and have the ability to systematically tackle ambiguous problems with a data-driven, hypothesis-based approach.


Next Steps

The position will be filled as soon as we find the right person, so make sure to apply as soon as you realize you really, really want to join us!

The compensation will be a negotiable combination of monthly pay and DoorDash RSUs. The latter makes it exceptionally easy to be excited about our company growing and doing well, as you’ll own a piece of the pie.

For any further questions about the position, you can turn to Product+ Talent Acquisition Partner - Zhanna Filintseva (zhanna.filintseva@wolt.com)

About Wolt

Wolt is a technology company that makes it incredibly easy to discover and get the best restaurants, grocery stores and other local shops delivered to your home or office. Wolt is not just a delivery app – we’re a technology company building a commerce platform to seamlessly connect our millions of customers with thousands of merchant and courier partners, in real-time across 23 countries and 250+ cities. Our apps (iOS and Android) have the industry’s highest ratings, largely thanks to our customer-first-mindset, which shows in how we build products and run operations. In June 2022 we officially joined forces with DoorDash. Combined, we have a presence in 27 countries, 23 of which operate with the Wolt brand and app. Wolt and DoorDash continue largely independently, with Wolt’s name, brand, product, technology and team.

Working in Product Development at Wolt

At Wolt, we’re about getting things done. You’ll probably enjoy it here if you like taking ownership, developing yourself and being around friendly, humble and ambitious people.

The behind the scenes of Wolt is run by an awesome bunch of over 400+ planners, builders, designers and data crunchers. We call ourselves Product+, as we’re the very core of Wolt’s products, tools and platforms. To build our products, we work in over 40 cross-functional, independent and autonomous teams. Teams are made up of a mix of talented individuals: engineers, designers, data scientists, analysts, and product leads. Each team takes ownership for solving customer problems in the best possible way.

Our Commitment to Diversity, Equity & Inclusion

We want to have all sorts of people in our team – people like you and me, and people different from you and me. To be able to work with diverse teammates – when it comes to gender, age, ethnicity, life background, sexual orientation, political views, religion, or any other personal trait – we consciously aim to offer equal opportunity for everyone to work with us. This is because we believe diverse teams make the most thought-through decisions and build things in the most inclusive way.

Join us today to build Wolt together!

Title: Staff Data Scientist
Description:
Hej, Truecaller is calling you from Stockholm, Sweden! Ready to pick up?




Our goal is to make communication smarter, safer, and more efficient, all while building trust everywhere. We're all about bringing you smart services with a big social impact, keeping you safe from fraud, harassment, scam calls, or messages, so you can focus on the conversations that matter.

Top 20 most downloaded apps globally, and world’s #1 caller ID and spam-blocking service for Android and iOS, with extensive AI capabilities, with more than 400 million active users per month.
Founded in 2009 with an impressive year-on-year growth with high profitability, listed on Nasdaq OMX Stockholm, Large Cap.
Founded in 2009, listed on Nasdaq OMX Stockholm and is categorized as a Large Cap. Our focus on innovation, operational excellence, sustainable growth, and collaboration has resulted in consistently high profitability and strong EBITDA margins.
A team of 400 people from ~35 different nationalities spread across our headquarters in Stockholm and offices in Bangalore, Mumbai, Gurgaon and Tel Aviv with high ambitions.







We, at the Data Science and Analytics Products team build centralized data products that serve the business and our customers. We collaborate across all of Truecaller, delivering products that require centralized ownership or where the competence to build the products is not present in the wider product organization.




As a Staff Data Scientist, you will be the right hand of the VP of Data Science and Analytics, you will take fuzzy business goals and transform them into data science products that can deliver value iteratively. Leading the data science work in the team, you will be responsible for structuring the work and ensuring that the outcomes match the business objectives. A significant part of this leadership will be coaching and mentoring other data scientists to guide and speed their development, as well as unblocking them and finding ways to make the team as happy and productive as possible.

Collaboration is a central requirement for this role, both when working with stakeholders, but also within the team to deliver results that cannot be delivered by one person on their own




The impact you will create:

Exploring the problem space and finding data science solutions that provide step increases in customer experience
Planning data science work for the team, with an emphasis on collaboration to achieve common goals
Gathering, collating, and understanding the data necessary to create data science products that delight the customers
Collaborating with stakeholders throughout Truecaller to find and build data science products that solve business and customer problems at scale.
Coaching and mentoring junior to senior data scientists to improve their technical skills and productivity




What you bring in:

Bachelor's or Master's degree in Data Science, Machine Learning, Computer Science, Statistics, Mathematics, or a related field.
At least 5 years of experience in using data science and machine learning to solve real-world problems
A track record leading data science projects in a team, collaborating in planning, coding, and communication
Excellent programming skills in Python and SQL
Solid understanding and experience with the tooling for Python - IDEs, unit testing frameworks, and static code checks
Excellent communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to present complex data and insights to non-technical stakeholders
Strong problem-solving skills and a results-oriented mindset
Customer obsession
Able to own and drive projects and products to production and iteratively improve them over time




It would be great if you also have

Understanding how to query very large data efficiently (we use BigQuery)
Experience collaborating with C-suite executives
Experience with data from mobile applications
Experience with data visualization and reporting tools, such as Tableau, Looker, or Power BI (we use Looker)
A solid understanding of the engineering requirements necessary to put machine learning solutions into production and scale them to hundreds of millions of customers




Life at Truecaller - Behind the code: https://www.instagram.com/lifeattruecaller/




Sounds like your dream job?

We will fill the position as soon as we find the right candidate, so please send your application as soon as possible. As part of the recruitment process, we will conduct a background check.




This position is based in Stockholm, Sweden.

We only accept applications in English.




What we offer:

A smart, talented, and agile team: An international team where ~35 nationalities are working together in several locations and time zones with a learning, sharing, and fun environment.
A great compensation package: Competitive salary, 30 days of paid vacation, flexible working hours, private health insurance, parental leave top-up, pension contribution, Udemy membership to keep learning and improving, and free gym membership.
Great tech tools: Pick the computer and phone you most fancy within our budget ranges.
Do it your way: We work in the office on Tuesdays, Wednesdays, and Thursdays with flexibility on the other days.
Office life: Enjoy your days with a wide range of yummy snacks and beverages, and have fun in our playroom! As well as in our exciting company parties and team activities such as Lab days, Running team, and Geek lunch!




Come as you are:

Truecaller is diverse, equal, and inclusive. We need a variety of backgrounds, perspectives, beliefs, and experiences to keep building our great products. No matter where you are based, which language you speak, your accent, race, religion, color, nationality, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, etc. All those things make you who you are, and that’s why we would love to meet you

Show more
HTML:
Hej, Truecaller is calling you from Stockholm, Sweden! Ready to pick up?


Our goal is to make communication smarter, safer, and more efficient, all while building trust everywhere. We're all about bringing you smart services with a big social impact, keeping you safe from fraud, harassment, scam calls, or messages, so you can focus on the conversations that matter.

  • Top 20 most downloaded apps globally, and world’s #1 caller ID and spam-blocking service for Android and iOS, with extensive AI capabilities, with more than 400 million active users per month.
  • Founded in 2009 with an impressive year-on-year growth with high profitability, listed on Nasdaq OMX Stockholm, Large Cap.
  • Founded in 2009, listed on Nasdaq OMX Stockholm and is categorized as a Large Cap. Our focus on innovation, operational excellence, sustainable growth, and collaboration has resulted in consistently high profitability and strong EBITDA margins.
  • A team of 400 people from ~35 different nationalities spread across our headquarters in Stockholm and offices in Bangalore, Mumbai, Gurgaon and Tel Aviv with high ambitions.



We, at the Data Science and Analytics Products team build centralized data products that serve the business and our customers. We collaborate across all of Truecaller, delivering products that require centralized ownership or where the competence to build the products is not present in the wider product organization.


As a Staff Data Scientist, you will be the right hand of the VP of Data Science and Analytics, you will take fuzzy business goals and transform them into data science products that can deliver value iteratively. Leading the data science work in the team, you will be responsible for structuring the work and ensuring that the outcomes match the business objectives. A significant part of this leadership will be coaching and mentoring other data scientists to guide and speed their development, as well as unblocking them and finding ways to make the team as happy and productive as possible.

Collaboration is a central requirement for this role, both when working with stakeholders, but also within the team to deliver results that cannot be delivered by one person on their own


The impact you will create:

  • Exploring the problem space and finding data science solutions that provide step increases in customer experience
  • Planning data science work for the team, with an emphasis on collaboration to achieve common goals
  • Gathering, collating, and understanding the data necessary to create data science products that delight the customers
  • Collaborating with stakeholders throughout Truecaller to find and build data science products that solve business and customer problems at scale.
  • Coaching and mentoring junior to senior data scientists to improve their technical skills and productivity


What you bring in:

  • Bachelor's or Master's degree in Data Science, Machine Learning, Computer Science, Statistics, Mathematics, or a related field.
  • At least 5 years of experience in using data science and machine learning to solve real-world problems
  • A track record leading data science projects in a team, collaborating in planning, coding, and communication
  • Excellent programming skills in Python and SQL
  • Solid understanding and experience with the tooling for Python - IDEs, unit testing frameworks, and static code checks
  • Excellent communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to present complex data and insights to non-technical stakeholders
  • Strong problem-solving skills and a results-oriented mindset
  • Customer obsession
  • Able to own and drive projects and products to production and iteratively improve them over time


It would be great if you also have

  • Understanding how to query very large data efficiently (we use BigQuery)
  • Experience collaborating with C-suite executives
  • Experience with data from mobile applications
  • Experience with data visualization and reporting tools, such as Tableau, Looker, or Power BI (we use Looker)
  • A solid understanding of the engineering requirements necessary to put machine learning solutions into production and scale them to hundreds of millions of customers

Title: Senior Data Scientist, Learning
Description:
We are looking for an entrepreneurial and business minded senior data scientist to join the band to help explore and execute on learning as a new opportunity for Spotify. It is a phenomenal role for someone who wants to work on a truly 0 to 1 project and have an impact on the company's growth trajectory!

As a data scientist in this team you’d partner with the full cross-functional team to help with research, data modeling and data-informed decision making related to building the product and driving impact for users, creators and the business. This is a fantastic opportunity to join our fast-paced team where you’ll get the chance to wear multiple hats and contribute to the product research and business analytics efforts to help craft and execute the product roadmap.

What You Are


Help build out the insights foundations that will allow us to gather conclusive evidence on the trajectory and viability of learning as an opportunity for Spotify. This includes instrumentation all the way through to analysis as well as understanding the learning space from multiple angles such as user, UX, content, marketing, creator and business perspectives to help inform decision making.
Develop business intelligence-, growth model- and product metrics framework.
Perform analysis on large sets of internal data to extract practical insights that will help drive product, platform and business decisions.
Design and conduct A/B tests to generate insights and drive impact across the entire learning product.
Build dashboards, data pipelines, and recurring reporting results, empowering business and product decision making
Develop models which power on- and off-platform promotion of learning based content
Help develop interest graph and content demand models for the content powering ML recommendations for users
Communicate data-driven insights and recommendations to key partners
Work closely and embedded with cross-functional team including engineering, product, design and business decision makers


Where You'll Do


You believe that Spotify can truly create an impact in the learning space and have a point of view on that.
You care end to end about the product, the implementation, the design, the creators, the business, and you are ready to wear multiple hats to achieve your goals.
You have experience in a data science role in a related field and expertise in science, computer science, statistics, economics, mathematics, or similar quantitative subject area.
You have experience with business intelligence, product analytics and complex data-driven decision making.
You have broad experience performing analysis with large datasets and strong understanding of experimentation, statistics and machine learning for decision making.
You value cross-disciplinary work and understand how to match qualitative research with your quantitative analysis.
You take pride in your ability to identify and solve complex, unfamiliar problems, and present them to the rest of the team.
You have a growth mindset, are curious and not afraid to be experimental. You share your ideas and continuously improve yourself and the team around you.
You have excellent skills across the data science stack including Python, SQL and visualization tools (we primarily use Jupyter notebooks, BigQuery and Tableau)


Where You'll Be


The team is distributed across the CET region with most people located in Stockholm and London.


#JobSite-Main-DataResearchAndInsights

#JobSite-Sub-DataScience

#HireRight Sweden Package

Today, we are the world’s most popular audio streaming subscription service.

Title: Senior Data Scientist (Analytics), Courier & Logistics
Description:
Job Description

We are looking for a Senior Data Scientist to join Wolt’s Courier & Logistics mission!

As the international side of Doordash business, Wolt is active in 27 countries outside of the US and growing. Together with functional and cross-functional partners, you’ll tackle highly impactful challenges to craft the most-loved platform for gig workers, empower local businesses with our robust logistics system. Ultimately, your efforts will connect consumers to everything they desire.

About The Role

Are you a creative thinker who thrives on turning ambiguous problems into business solutions? As a Data Scientist at Wolt, you’ll dive deep into our data to tackle crucial business challenges. You will diagnose problem areas, develop new metrics, design experiments, uncover foundational causal relationships in our data, and influence strategic decisions. This role combines scientific expertise with stakeholder engagement, positioning you at the forefront of driving business outcomes.

We’re seeking someone who enjoys finding patterns amidst chaos, is excited to build solutions from the ground up, and has a proven track record in using data science to solve business problems. You will work closely with Product, Engineering, Design, and Operations teams to guide measurement strategies and tactical decisions, helping to expand the Wolt platform globally. If you take ownership of business outcomes and are proactive in driving change, we want you on our team!

Our offering to you


The online delivery platform that Wolt is building will offer you interesting and complex challenges together with the opportunities to create a big impact with your skills. Lots of geolocational and temporal data in real-time combined with differences in the economics and dynamics of the cities we operate in make Wolt both a challenging and so interesting company to practice analytics.
You can choose the location from our tech hubs in Berlin, Helsinki and Stockholm, or you can work entirely remotely anywhere in Germany, Finland and Sweden. You have the chance to decide the ways of working — a hybrid, at the office, or remote within the location above. 💙 Read more about our remote setup.
You would get to work in a company culture where we take ownership beyond the obvious, do common things uncommonly well, we think big but stay humble, do right by people, we treat others kindly and justly, recognize that if we don’t learn, we won’t stay still but fall behind. Read more about how we work.


Our humble expectations


Degree in Mathematics, Statistics, Computer Science, or a related field.
Have over 5 years of experience in a data science or analytics position within an industry or research setting.
Expertise in statistical analysis, including hypothesis testing, experimentation, and regression analysis using statistical software packages in Python, Matlab, R, or equivalent.
Expertise in causal inference and quasi-experimentation.
Proficiency in writing structured and efficient SQL queries for large data sets.
Relentless pursuit of new ideas and data sources, and the ability to systematically tackle ambiguous problems with a data-driven, hypothesis-based approach.
Be analytical, inquisitive, and a self-starter who is motivated to achieve results and collaborate with colleagues both inside and outside of the team.


Next Steps

The position will be filled as soon as we find the right person, so make sure to apply as soon as you realize you really, really want to join us!

The compensation will be a negotiable combination of monthly pay and DoorDash RSUs. The latter makes it exceptionally easy to be excited about our company growing and doing well, as you’ll own a piece of the pie.

For any further questions about the position, you can turn to Product+ Talent Acquisition Partner - Zhanna Filintseva (zhanna.filintseva@wolt.com)

About Wolt

Wolt is a technology company that makes it incredibly easy to discover and get the best restaurants, grocery stores and other local shops delivered to your home or office. Wolt is not just a delivery app – we’re a technology company building a commerce platform to seamlessly connect our millions of customers with thousands of merchant and courier partners, in real-time across 23 countries and 250+ cities. Our apps (iOS and Android) have the industry’s highest ratings, largely thanks to our customer-first-mindset, which shows in how we build products and run operations. In June 2022 we officially joined forces with DoorDash. Combined, we have a presence in 27 countries, 23 of which operate with the Wolt brand and app. Wolt and DoorDash continue largely independently, with Wolt’s name, brand, product, technology and team.

Working in Product Development at Wolt

At Wolt, we’re about getting things done. You’ll probably enjoy it here if you like taking ownership, developing yourself and being around friendly, humble and ambitious people.

The behind the scenes of Wolt is run by an awesome bunch of over 400+ planners, builders, designers and data crunchers. We call ourselves Product+, as we’re the very core of Wolt’s products, tools and platforms. To build our products, we work in over 40 cross-functional, independent and autonomous teams. Teams are made up of a mix of talented individuals: engineers, designers, data scientists, analysts, and product leads. Each team takes ownership for solving customer problems in the best possible way.

Our Commitment to Diversity, Equity & Inclusion

We want to have all sorts of people in our team – people like you and me, and people different from you and me. To be able to work with diverse teammates – when it comes to gender, age, ethnicity, life background, sexual orientation, political views, religion, or any other personal trait – we consciously aim to offer equal opportunity for everyone to work with us. This is because we believe diverse teams make the most thought-through decisions and build things in the most inclusive way.

Join us today to build Wolt together!


Show more

Title: Data Scientist to a startup within mobile games
Description:
Our client is a Mobile Games studio in Stockholm, and is looking for an experienced Data Scientist who likes to tinker with data engineering and analytics.




Responsibilities:




Develop and Manage Databases: Design and maintain databases and data warehouses, ensuring efficient storage, retrieval, and data integrity.
Performance Optimization: Optimize database performance through indexing, query optimization, and regular maintenance.
Data Cleaning and Preprocessing: Clean and preprocess raw data to ensure quality and suitability for analysis, effectively handling missing data, outliers, and other data quality issues.
Model Performance Monitoring: Continuously monitor model performance, making necessary adjustments to maintain accuracy and relevance over time.
Data Visualization: Create compelling data visualizations and dashboards to present data insights clearly and effectively.
Communication of Complex Data: Use visualization tools to facilitate the understanding and communication of complex data.
Data Analysis: Analyze large datasets to extract actionable insights, identifying trends, patterns, and correlations that inform strategic decisions.




About You

We believe you have a background in data engineering and analytics within the gaming industry and have a passion for mobile games.




Requirements:




SQL Proficiency: Expert in SQL for querying and managing relational databases.
Google BigQuery Expertise: Experienced in using Google BigQuery for data warehousing, including understanding its SQL dialect and optimization techniques.
Scalable Database Solutions: Knowledgeable in creating distributed and scalable database solutions.
ETL Pipelines: Experienced in developing and managing ETL pipelines for data ingestion, processing, and transformation.
Statistical Analysis and Data Mining: Skilled in statistical analysis and data mining techniques to uncover insights from large datasets.
Dashboard Development: Proficient in building dashboards and supporting self-sufficient data models.
Cross-Functional Collaboration: Experience working in cross-functional teams, providing data insights to support product improvements.




Their office is located in central Stockholm, and they all work on-site. They are looking for someone who wants to do the same.

Title: Machine Learning Engineer – Data & Analytics at SEB in Stockholm
Description:
SEB is more than just a bank with an IT function. We are a progressive tech company powered by innovation and fueled by collaboration. From Java to AI and everything in between, we offer you an impressive tech stack and several technology paths. Together we're innovating for a sustainable society and building the tech arena of the future, a welcoming space for everyone.

We are looking for a Machine Learning Engineer to strengthen our team in Stockholm, working with our scalable Advanced Analytics products.

About The Job

We are working together with our colleagues from different parts of SEB to provide advanced analytics to all at SEB. Our team consists of world-class Data Scientists and Machine Learning Engineers. Together we design, develop and deploy ML models to GCP and deliver value from data and analytics.

Together, we will increase the frequency of finding valuable insights within our data in the bank waiting to be found. Our team is dedicated to making data science and machine learning accessible by creating user-friendly, secure and governed tools that standardize the ways of working.

We belong to the SEB Data & Analytics tribe, an international environment with multiple agile development teams working in an enterprise superset of scrum located in Stockholm and Vilnius, consisting of experts in various Big Data and Advanced Analytics technologies.

Who are you?

We are looking for an engineer with system operations experience and an interest in system development and machine learning.

You and your fellow team members will create and maintain products in the Advanced Analytics team, together with data scientists and other internal customers.

If you are analytical, curious and have a passion for problem-solving and discovering new ways of working, you will enjoy it here. Especially if you also like Swedish fika!

Required Skills


A degree in engineering, computer or data science, or equivalent work experience
Experience from designing, implementing and deploying ML models
Experience from working in Linux environments
Programming and scripting skills (e.g. Python and bash scripting)
Experience in developing services (e.g. REST APIs)
Collaboration skills and a high sense of responsibility. We always work and deliver as a team, and the ability to share knowledge and experience is fundamental.
Well-versed in matters of IT security
Automation and configuration management systems (e.g. Ansible, Terraform, Chef)
Cloud technologies, such as GCP
CI/CD, such as GitHub Actions or GitLab pipelines


Nice-to-have


Programming skills in Java and Scala
Experience in working with container orchestration (e.g. Docker, Kubernetes, OpenShift).
Data engineering experience, e.g. Apache Spark
Database knowledge (RDBMS and/or NoSQL)
Knowledge of authentication and authorization services (e.g. Kerberos, LDAP, OAuth 2.0)


Learn More About Working At SEB At Www.sebgroup.com/career

It is our fundamental belief that inclusion and diversity are crucial for our future success. We strive to have an inclusive, value-driven culture where employees feel valued, respected and involved irrespective of who they are, what they believe or where they come from.

Great people often know great people – please share if you have a friend who would love this job.

Welcome with your application

Attach your CV and a personal letter describing yourself and how you can contributeto our journey. We will contact candidates on a running basis, feel free to send in your application today, but no later than 2024-08-31. Please note that due to the summer holiday season, responses might take a bit longer.

If you have questions about the position, please contact Dina Dervisevic, EngineeringManager – Advanced Analytics and Data Services, at dina.dervisevic@seb.se

SEB Sweden has a redeployment responsibility, why this position might be covered by internal redeployment.
Show more

  • Experience in developing services (e.g. REST APIs)
  • Collaboration skills and a high sense of responsibility. We always work and deliver as a team, and the ability to share knowledge and experience is fundamental.
  • Well-versed in matters of IT security
  • Automation and configuration management systems (e.g. Ansible, Terraform, Chef)
  • Cloud technologies, such as GCP
  • CI/CD, such as GitHub Actions or GitLab pipelines

Nice-to-have

  • Programming skills in Java and Scala
  • Experience in working with container orchestration (e.g. Docker, Kubernetes, OpenShift).
  • Data engineering experience, e.g. Apache Spark
  • Database knowledge (RDBMS and/or NoSQL)
  • Knowledge of authentication and authorization services (e.g. Kerberos, LDAP, OAuth 2.0)

Learn More About Working At SEB At Www.sebgroup.com/career

It is our fundamental belief that inclusion and diversity are crucial for our future success. We strive to have an inclusive, value-driven culture where employees feel valued, respected and involved irrespective of who they are, what they believe or where they come from.

Great people often know great people – please share if you have a friend who would love this job.

Welcome with your application

Attach your CV and a personal letter describing yourself and how you can contributeto our journey. We will contact candidates on a running basis, feel free to send in your application today, but no later than 2024-08-31. Please note that due to the summer holiday season, responses might take a bit longer.

If you have questions about the position, please contact Dina Dervisevic, EngineeringManager – Advanced Analytics and Data Services, at dina.dervisevic@seb.se

SEB Sweden has a redeployment responsibility, why this position might be covered by internal redeployment.

Title: Data Scientist, Solna
Description:
We seek to strengthen our position and increase the speed of the implementation of data science, machine learning and AI solutions in PostNord. We are looking for three Data Scientists who will play an important role in helping PostNord to become an AI and data driven business. We offer you a cutting-edge Analytics environment, very competent colleagues as well as good benefits and a really cool office. Apply now to the Data Scientist role!

Join us

The Technology Acceleration area with Group IT is responsible for establishing the future IT landscape that will be the foundation for PostNord' s continued AI and data driven journey. PostNord is the leader of logistics and postal services in the Nordics. As a Data Scientist at PostNord you will engage in projects, combining technical expertise within areas such data collection and exploration, model development and model deployment and operation. As a Data Scientist, you will are able to independently develop and deploy models, both statistical and machine learning. We are looking for data scientists for our existing ML team which delivers production volume forecast to PostNords business and we are also looking for data scientists to our newly formed AI- and Concept development teams. It is our goal to deploy efficient and accurate models and keep the models up to date through a set of well-defined MLOps practices.

Job Duties


Work in an agile team to deliver the best possible data solutions for PostNord.
Identify, prepare, explore and analyze data from various data sets.
Understand the business requirements and develop ML solutions accordingly.
Ensure best practices, such as quality and security, are followed in all stages of the product development life cycle.
Identify, collect and analyze data and train new ML models.
Collaborate within team boundaries aiming to share knowledge and best practices.
Keeps up to date with data science trends in and outside of PostNord.
Sound knowledge of statistics and machine learning.
take ownership of the teams solutions whether new or old and help establish best in class MLOps .


We are looking for you who have


A bachelor's degree or higher in computer science, mathematics, statistics, or a related field.
At least 3-5 years of work experience
Proficiency in Python and at least one of the following frameworks: TensorFlow, PyTorch, Keras, or Scikit-learn.
Sound knowledge of statistics
Strong knowledge of machine learning concepts and techniques, such as supervised and unsupervised learning, classification, regression, clustering, feature engineering, and model evaluation.
Experience in applying machine learning methods to real-world data sets and problems, preferably in the domain of production forecasting or time series analysis.
Understanding of core AI and ML concepts, algorithms, and their applications
Ability to communicate effectively with both technical and non-technical stakeholders, and to translate business requirements into data-driven solutions.
Experience in working with time series data and using frameworks such as PyTorch, TensorFlow, or Keras for building and training neural network models for forecasting or anomaly detection.


Your profile as an Data Scientist

You have worked with statistical analysis and Machine Learning solutions in an agile team before. You like to work hands on, and to work directly with our business stakeholders. You have an academic background and as a person you are curious to learn and evolve your skill set in accordance with the state-of-the-art pace in the domain that you work in.

Meritorious experience: (Nice-to-have)


Experience in developing and deploying end-to-end machine learning pipelines in cloud-based environments (Azure preferred) using tools such as MLflow, Azure ML Studio and Azure DevOps.
Experience in working with cloud platforms (Azure preferred) and using their services for data storage, processing, and analysis.
Data visualisation experience; preferably in Power BI
Prior experience implementing generative AI/LLM’s or ML.
Experience in applying DevOps principles and practices to machine learning projects, such as version control, testing, continuous integration, and continuous delivery.
Experience in using containerization and orchestration tools such as Docker, Kubernetes, or Helm for building and deploying scalable and reproducible machine learning applications.


System requirements:


Azure ML Studio, Azure DevOps, Azure Open AI (or similar AWS/GCP technologies)
Python, Pandas
SQL
Power BI


Language requirement:

Fluent English in speech and writing. Proficiency in at least one Scandinavian language is meritorious.

We offer you

Benefits

We offer you a flexible hybrid workplace with a prestige-free environment where we as a team help each other to reach our goals. We encourage self-sufficient leadership for development and career opportunities. In addition to the benefits mentioned above, we offer:


Work in a Nordic/International and flexible environment.
Good insurance and occupational pension conditions
Wellness allowance & access to office gym and swimming pool
Employee benefits through PostNord's own employee foundation PostNord Plus
Employment according to a collective agreement.


We make everyday life easier

PostNord is the leading supplier of communication and logistics solutions to, from, and within the Nordic region. We ensure the provision of a postal service to households and businesses in Sweden and Denmark. We aim to make everyday life easier and more sustainable for everyone who lives and works in the Nordic region.

We are accountable, brave and committed, effectively leading change regardless if we lead our self or others. We emphasize teamwork, sincerity and positive relationships in the workplace. We build on our success and learn from both colleagues and mistakes. People with different backgrounds work with us. You will therefore be part of a workplace with great diversity, which contributes to better results for the business. Visit us at postnord.com

Apply

We look forward to receiving your application! If you have any questions or concerns, you are welcome to contact Christian Mejlvang, Christian.mejlvang@postnord.com

Click here for union contacts


Show more
