Title: AI Engineer
Description:
Are you interested in contributing to the advancement of AI in mobile and web app development? Join us as an AI Engineer at Bontouch, where you'll play a key role in integrating Generative AI and Large Language Models into transformative applications for global brands. 🚀 This role involves developing and deploying scalable AI solutions that enhance functionality and user engagement. If you’re passionate about innovation in a collaborative setting and eager to continuously learn and grow, we invite you to help us shape the future of digital experiences. Together, let’s make a meaningful impact. ✨💪

BECOME A PART OF THE TEAM

At Bontouch, we work based on one simple but ambitious principle: to make the world’s greatest apps for the best brands on the planet. Currently, we work with partners such as Swish, PostNord, SJ, SEB, among many others, to build highly useful, beautiful-looking mobile and web apps that make life easier for millions of users in the real world.

During summer 2023, we joined forces with Denmark’s leading app agency Shape as well as Waterland Private Equity with the goal to create the leading digital product agency worldwide. This new venture is called Framna, and we want you to be part of our journey! 🚀

🏢 Joining our office in Stockholm, you will get to work in a cross-functional dedicated in-house team consisting of developers, designers, QA testers, analysts, and a product lead and team lead.

💼 Your day-to-day will include everything from leading AI research and model development, and deploying solutions at scale, to communicating, educating, and managing stakeholders and their expectations.

🌱 Finally, you also have the support of other AI enthusiasts with different backgrounds, such as data analysts, developers, and designers, who work on our AI projects to learn from one another, share experiences, develop new skill sets, and collaborate.

What You'll Do

As an AI Engineer with us, you’ll play a crucial role in pushing our AI initiatives forward, ensuring they're not just well-loved, but also tailored to our users’ needs. 🌟 If you're into dreaming up big AI ideas and getting your hands dirty coding and deploying them, you'll fit right in here.

More Specifically, In Your Role, You Will Be


Leading the exploration and application of LLMs and Generative AI, venturing into new areas within these fields, including multi-modal capabilities. You will be the go-to expert when creating new business opportunities, assisting sales, and pitching AI solutions to our partners.
Developing, testing, deploying, and evaluating AI models, focusing on scalability and efficiency.
Managing and improving data pipelines that are the backbone for training our AI models, making sure they perform at their best.
Collaborating in cross-functional teams to integrate AI solutions and lead projects that enhance our AI capabilities.
Sharing what you learn and discover about AI with our internal teams and external partners. Your insights will help us all grow.
Taking the lead on internal projects using Generative AI to make our company smarter and more efficient, leveraging all the cool AI tools out there.
Keeping your finger on the pulse of the latest AI trends and breakthroughs, so we’re always ahead of the curve.


Who We Think You Are

Are you ready to make this role your own? 🙌 We believe you might feel at home with us if you have:


A Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or related fields.
Hands-on work experience in AI, machine learning, LLMs, including prompt engineering, fine-tuning, RAG.
Experience with at least one of the cloud platforms, AWS, Azure, and GCP.
Strong programming skills in Python and experience with DevOps tools such as Kubernetes and Docker.
Familiarity with AI/ML frameworks (e.g. LangChain, LLM orchestration frameworks).
Experience with data engineering tools and platforms, and can handle large, complex datasets.
Great problem-solving and analytical skills, with an ability to work on complex projects and translate business challenges into AI/ML-driven solutions.
Strong communication skills with the ability to effectively convey complex technical concepts to non-technical stakeholders, both internally and externally.
An adaptable and collaborative spirit, you thrive in a changing environment and enjoy working collaboratively with a team dedicated to innovation.


Benefits Of Working At Bontouch


A beautiful office in the heart of Stockholm, a hybrid-remote work setup, flexible working hours, as well as some other pretty neat benefits like a generous wellness grant, top-up on your parental leave, occupational pension, and much more. ✨
A culture of sharing. We have Friday demos, Wednesday lunch-and-learn, conceptathons, and Product Lead camps. We host an internal conference with all of our studios once a year – every time in a different part of the world. 🗺️
A flexible environment where you get to explore and create your role based on your passion.


Are you curious about our benefits and what it is like to work with us? Read about us here 👈

About Bontouch

At Bontouch, we work based on one simple but ambitious principle: to make the world’s greatest apps for the best brands on the planet. To have the greatest impact on users all over the world, we partner up with our favorite companies to create highly useful, beautiful-looking, visionary mobile and web apps that make life easier for millions of users in the real world. We work with partners such as Swish, PostNord, SJ, SEB, among many others. We offer our partners a unique long-term engagement model where we provide all the skills required for modern digital product development including strategy, design, development, testing, and maintenance.

What is the secret of our success? We are a team, we work together, learn from each other, and trust in each other. For us, collaboration, knowledge exchange, our diverse backgrounds, and shared passion for creating the best possible digital products are our winning combination. We work together in-house in our Bontouch studios to ensure that we deliver products of the highest quality with the end user in focus.

Bontouch is the leading app agency in Sweden and has together with leading agency in Denmark (Shape) joined forces with Waterland Private Equity in 2023 with a joint ambition to create the leading digital product agency worldwide. Today the group consists of more than 400 employees across offices in Copenhagen, Stockholm, Zurich, New York, London, Åre, Östersund and Kalmar. The group will continue to grow organically while pursuing international expansion through acquisitions of digital product agencies that have achieved a leading position in their respective markets by delivering best-in-class mobile apps.

HIRING PROCESS

🕵️ Psychometric assessment - Skills and Logical Reasoning test

👥 1st meeting with the Talent Acquisition Specialist

🎬 Technical challenge and case study presentation

🎯 Final meeting

We serve clients in North America, Europe and Asia from five studios in Sweden, London and New York. The products we help create are used by more than 50 million people in 195 countries. Read about our products at bontouch.com

Title: AI Engineer
Description:
Odevo is a group of exciting brands with a shared vision of challenging status quo in the property management industry. We are committed to revolutionizing the industry with innovative software solutions that make managing properties easier, more efficient, and more effective. Our rapidly growing product and engineering organization is approaching 100 highly skilled professionals.




Our cloud-based platform is unique, and in a brief time, we have proven ourselves as a leading and innovative player on the market. Our product development department acts as a SaaS supplier to all the companies in the Odevo group and several other players in the industry. Together, we will continue to challenge and change this industry. To continue our ambitious growth journey, we seek more great people to join us to build market-leading property management software products. Are you one of them?




The role:

As an AI Engineer, you will be part of a team that is responsible for our organization's AI-focused initiatives, unlocking the full potential of artificial intelligence to create transformative solutions for our business opportunities. With your expertise in generative AI, you and your team will lead the charge in crafting cutting-edge AI strategies and solutions. You will be pivotal in defining how we apply AI solutions to business problems. We want to deeply integrate AI across our organization, drive innovation and ensure that AI is a clear part of our business strategy.




You will be reporting to our CTO and Head of AI Product.




Who You Are:

You are an experienced and driven software engineer who has been part of the generative AI wave, and both experimented with and shipped applications to real users. Complex challenges do not deter you; they intrigue you. You tackle them methodically, finding practical solutions that truly make a difference.




You prefer working in a team with developers, designers and product managers and deeply collaborate with your team rather than working from specifications. You communicate effectively and can discuss the pros and cons of different options in constructive ways.

As the AI field is moving forward at enormous speed, you are constantly following tech news for interesting developments that you can use to solve business problems.




Responsibilities

Collaborate closely with cross-functional teams, including engineers, and product managers, to define requirements and deliver AI solutions that meet business needs.
Stay up to date with the latest developments in generative AI, actively following open-source projects and explore innovative AI technologies that can benefit the organization.
Create prototypes and proof-of-concepts to demonstrate the feasibility and potential of AI solutions to stakeholders.
Continuously optimize AI models and algorithms for efficiency and scalability.
Document architecture designs, algorithms, and best practices for knowledge sharing within the organization.
Provide guidance and mentorship to AI ambassadors in the organization, fostering their growth, development, and contribution to AI use in their respective departments.




Qualifications

Bachelor's or Master's degree in Computer Science, Machine Learning, or a related field.
Proven experience with generative AI.
Please provide sources to your work in your application - You will be asked to demo your experience in the interview process
Interest in both open-source AI frameworks, libraries as well as closed-source projects, having contributed is a strong plus.
Proficiency in machine learning techniques, frameworks, big data, and programming languages.
Proficiency in Swedish




What we offer

Hybrid/remote work environment - you will be part of a team based in and around Stockholm that values collaboration and communication, regardless of location.
Professional growth - to work with the most talented developers in the industry.
Modern technology - we invest in the latest technologies and tools, we sign agreements with the largest players, and we encourage our team members to share their ideas and take ownership of their work to form a collaborative environment where AI is used throughout the group.
Innovation - to work on exciting projects that push the boundaries of our industry and make a real impact.
Commitment to quality - a dynamic and forward-thinking company that values profitable and long-term product development.




Location

We are remote-friendly, but we find great value in being able to connect with our teams in person. The product development team you will work with is in Stockholm, and the ability to spend face-to-face time with them is important.




Excited?

If you are excited about being part of a successful team, we encourage you to apply for this position.

Show more

  • Interest in both open-source AI frameworks, libraries as well as closed-source projects, having contributed is a strong plus.
  • Proficiency in machine learning techniques, frameworks, big data, and programming languages.
  • Proficiency in Swedish


What we offer

  • Hybrid/remote work environment - you will be part of a team based in and around Stockholm that values collaboration and communication, regardless of location.
  • Professional growth - to work with the most talented developers in the industry.
  • Modern technology - we invest in the latest technologies and tools, we sign agreements with the largest players, and we encourage our team members to share their ideas and take ownership of their work to form a collaborative environment where AI is used throughout the group.
  • Innovation - to work on exciting projects that push the boundaries of our industry and make a real impact.
  • Commitment to quality - a dynamic and forward-thinking company that values profitable and long-term product development.


Location

We are remote-friendly, but we find great value in being able to connect with our teams in person. The product development team you will work with is in Stockholm, and the ability to spend face-to-face time with them is important.


Excited?

If you are excited about being part of a successful team, we encourage you to apply for this position.

Title: Data Scientist in Computer Vision
Description:
Scania aims to drive the shift towards a sustainable transport system, creating a world of mobility that is better for business, society, and the environment. Our department plays a central role in this journey by providing the information, tools, and systems needed to maintain, diagnose, repair, and upgrade the products qualitatively and cost-effectively.

About Us

We are a highly motivated and skilled team that values each other's ideas and supports one another whenever needed. Working in an agile manner, we continuously strive to enhance our methods. The team comprises Data Scientists, Machine Learning Engineers, Data Engineers, and Cloud Engineers. Our journey thus far has been notable, solidifying our reputation as a leading AI team engaged in the entire development process—from data collection to modelling, testing, and deploying ML models in production. However, to further elevate our achievements and scale our initiatives, it's imperative that our team grows.

You will together with the team



Develop, implement, and maintain state-of-the-art YOLO object detection models tailored for real-time applications, specifically in vehicle maintenance workshops.
Develop and evaluate different methods and frameworks to enhance YOLO object detection model performance in a production environment, optimizing data collection and annotation processes.
Utilize Active Learning techniques to improve the efficiency and effectiveness of the training process by selecting the most informative data points from large-scale video streams.
Optimize data annotation processes and manage the challenges of handling large volumes of video data in real-time, ensuring high-quality model training data.
Utilize Agile methodology to ensure efficient and value-driven project delivery.



As a key member of our Data Science team, you will collaborate with diverse teams across the organization, from R&D to Sales & Marketing and beyond, as well as with other Data Science teams at Scania.

Our dream candidate

We are looking for someone with:



A background in engineering and a Master's degree in Machine Learning, Data Science, or a related field.
Solid knowledge and experience in Image/Video processing, YOLOv8, evaluation metrics for object detection (such as IoU and mAP), Deep Learning, Python, AWS, and Active Learning Frameworks.
The ability to work independently and effectively within an Agile environment and to collaborate across multidisciplinary teams.



As a person, we expect you to be structured, communicative, and service-minded. Fluency in English, both spoken and written, is essential.

What We Offer

We offer an inspiring workplace, with great respect for the individual, where you have great opportunities to shape your work and your future. Your personal and professional development is essential and something we encourage and support.

In addition, we offer benefits such as employee car, mutual bonus, occupational pension, flexible working hours, lunch at reduced prices, and much more. If you live in Stockholm, we offer a direct bus service between Stockholm and Södertälje, Scania Job Express.

Additional Information

Please contact Jesper Brauer, Head of Strategic Product Planning and Advanced Analytics, +46 8 553 50078.

Application

Your application should include a CV, personal letter, and grade copies. Please apply as soon as possible but no later than 2024-08-29. Ongoing selection and interviews will take place during the application period, the position may be filled before the end of the application period.

We use logic and personality tests in our selection process and a background check may be conducted for this position.

Welcome to apply!
Show more

Title: Data Scientist - Stockholm - 6 months + - hybrid
Description:
Job Opportunity: Data Scientist - Stockholm (6+ Months Contract) - hybrid



Key Responsibilities:



Solution Design and Implementation:

Develop and implement AI and machine learning solutions to predict and proactively manage operational challenges.
Create architectural designs incorporating predictive analytics and AI-driven insights using tools such as Splunk, Dynatrace, Azure, Google Cloud Platform (GCP), and Vertex AI.
Oversee the implementation of value-driven solutions, ensuring timely delivery, adherence to budget, and high quality.

Stakeholder Collaboration:

Collaborate with business analysts, product managers, and development teams to translate business requirements into technical specifications.
Engage with stakeholders to understand their needs and ensure solutions meet their requirements, leveraging tools like ServiceNow for IT service management and workflow automation, and Atlassian tools (Jira, Confluence) for project management and collaboration.

Technical Expertise:

Stay updated on AI, machine learning, and AIOps trends and advancements to apply them in solving business problems.
Provide guidance in software development, systems architecture, and integration using GCP & Azure for cloud computing and data management solutions.
Evaluate and recommend tools, technologies, and methodologies, including but not limited to Vertex AI for machine learning model training and deployment in GCP or any Azure-equivalent.

Documentation and Communication:

Produce detailed technical documentation to support solution implementation and maintenance, utilizing Confluence for collaborative documentation.
Communicate architectural decisions, plans, and strategies effectively to stakeholders and development teams using Jira for project tracking and issue management.

Quality Assurance:

Ensure implemented solutions meet industry standards and business requirements.
Conduct regular reviews and audits to uphold architectural principles and identify areas for improvement, using tools for monitoring and performance management.


Qualifications:


Proven experience in AI, AIOps, machine learning, and data science.
Strong proficiency with GCP, Azure, Vertex AI, Splunk, and Dynatrace.
Excellent collaboration and communication skills.
Ability to produce and maintain detailed technical documentation.
Strong project management skills with experience using Jira and Confluence.

Please apply to c.kaluza(a)globalenterprisepartners.com.

Best regards,

Caroline

Title: Senior ML Engineer - AI Services
Description:
Schibsted Media is a family of well-known media brands across Norway, Sweden and Finland. Our winning ambition is to be the leading media destination in Nordics. To reach our ambition we strive to offer the best and most relevant products in the media industry, making it even more attractive for readers, listeners, viewers, and advertisers to engage with our universe.

Data and AI is the central organisation within Schibsted Media that is responsible for its data platform, and builds data and AI products with emphasis on volume, velocity and privacy that serve the whole of Schibsted Media and its brands.

AI Services is a team within Data&AI that is currently responsible for developing and maintaining machine learning models that are empowering many use cases in Schibsted such as: producing insights and analytics about our customers, segments for the online advertising on our sites and personalization of news. We are working with big amounts of data from newspapers (like VG, Aftenposten, Aftonbladet, Bergens Tidene) and we are also looking for new ways to enhance user experience by adding new capabilities to our portfolio, which include working with content data and other exciting opportunities.

We are looking for an experienced ML Engineer, who is independent, goal oriented and loves working with Big Data. We practise a product-oriented mindset, so you will be working alongside the product management team to find the best solutions to meet the needs of our internal stakeholders.

What you will do:


Contribute to analysis, design, building, training, evaluation, shipping and refinement of ML-driven products to solve real-world problems
Collaborate closely with a cross-functional agile team spanning data science, product management, and engineering to build prototypes as well as production-ready solutions
Engage with internal stakeholders and end-users to better understand their needs, as well as explain, educate, and support them in ML matters
Provide guidance to more junior team members


What is our technology stack?


Data Processing: Luigi/Spark/Scala -> Flyte/PySpark/Python. We are currently in the process of migration, consider the latter to be the future, however you might be required to work with some of the older pipelines before they are migrated
Machine Learning: Tensorflow, Pytorch
Infrastructure: Docker, Kubernetes as a main platform for both processing and services, AWS as cloud provider (S3, EKS)


Job Requirements


You have at least a Master's degree in Computer Science, Software Engineering, Applied Mathematics, or any quantitative field
3+ years of related industry experience in the data science domain and a deep understanding of AI and machine learning methods and algorithms
You have great communication skills, can communicate complex concepts in a simple way, and articulate solutions to other team members and non-technical people
Solid knowledge of Python with the ability to write performant production-quality code, other programming languages are a bonus
Experience working with Pandas, Transformers and Tensorflow/Keras or Pytorch
Experience working with Spark, Databricks or other big data technologies
Experience working with Kubernetes and AWS (or any other cloud provider)


As a part of Schibsted, you will also have the opportunity to share knowledge and learn from other data engineers across the organisation. We encourage a diverse, collaborative and creative work environment, where you will develop and push for state-of-the-art solutions in big data processing as well as building reliable and highly scalable services.
Show more

Title: Python Backend Developer - Remote
Description:
Location: Latin America/Europe - Permanent Remote

Experience: 6 - 15 Years

Role Type: Contracting Full Time (40 Hrs/week)

Overlap Hours: 8 Hours PST time

Contract Duration: 3-6 Months

Mandatory Skills

Python- 5 years,

Django- 5 years,

SQL-5 years.

Hands-on experience with the AWS cloud is mandatory

Total years of exp- 6+ years experience mandatory

Required Skills


7+ years of experience in software development - ( Purely backend )
Coding experience in server-side programming languages (e.g. Python, Go, Java, Ruby) as well as database languages (SQL)
Experience working with server-side MVC frameworks (e.g. Django, .NET, Spring, Rails, Phoenix)
Past experience and success in building and supporting scalable APIs, services, or applications
Bachelor’s/Master’s degree in Computer Science or equivalent experience
Exceptional verbal, written, and interpersonal communication skills. You are adept at communicating relevant information clearly and concisely.
Deep understanding of customer needs and passion for customer success.
Exhibit core behaviors focused on craftsmanship, continuous improvement, and team success
Ability to look ahead to identify opportunities, foster a culture of innovation, and build for scale.
Excellent spoken and written English communication skills


About The Role

A globally recognised firm is seeking a talented and experienced Senior Backend Engineer to join their Carriers team! The Carriers team is responsible for developing new features, building infrastructure and maintaining current services. As a Senior Engineer, he/she will provide leadership and oversight in technical design, systems architecture, and coding for their team and the Engineering team.

Responsibility

Design, implement, test, and deploy software services with high SLAs that can handle millions of requests a day.


Ensure scalability and maintainability through microservices adoption, decoupling of concerns from the data model, queuing of jobs, application layering and container-based software distribution.
Continue to build out and enhance our CI/CD pipeline for smooth and safe production releases via automated testing and verification.
Verify and ensure performance and correctness of systems in response time and throughput.
Architect systems and refactor existing systems for optimal performance and reuse
Participate in peer reviews, testing and in design reviews for new features, products, and systems
Collaborate with business teams and provide early input to new product ideas and functionality
Define, implement, and monitor operational metrics to ensure performance and quality.
Work with a sense of urgency and iterate quickly in an agile process.
Mentor more junior engineers on engineering best practices.
Exceptional problem solving skills: demonstrated ability to understand business challenges and translate those into technical solutions.

Title: Senior Machine Learning Engineer
Description:
Description

What makes us Qlik?

A Gartner® Magic Quadrant™ Leader for 13 years in a row, Qlik transforms complex data landscapes into actionable insights, driving strategic business outcomes. Serving over 40,000 global customers, our portfolio leverages pervasive data quality and advanced AI/ML capabilities that lead to better decisions, faster.

We excel in integration and governance solutions that work with diverse data sources, and our real-time analytics uncover hidden patterns, empowering teams to address complex challenges and seize new opportunities.

The Senior Machine Learning Engineer Role

Join Qlik as a Senior ML Engineer and be at the forefront of shaping the future of AI in the data and analytics field. Contribute to developing innovative AI products, solving complex challenges, and pioneering the responsible and ethical implementation of AI.

What makes this role interesting?

Diverse Use Cases: Design, develop, and maintain a set of AI products that address a diverse range of use cases, including predictive, generative, and classification scenarios.

Collaborative Innovation: Collaborate with a dynamic team of data scientists, software engineers, and domain experts to create user-friendly AI solutions.

Multicultural Environment: Be part of a multicultural and highly collaborative environment, contributing to a creative and team-oriented culture.

Pioneering Integration: Pioneer the combination of structured and unstructured data, unlocking new use cases and hidden insights.

Semantic Search Development: Build semantic search capabilities on our platform, translate natural language into analytic queries, and continuously improve AI responses based on user behaviour.

Here’s How You’ll Be Making An Impact


Strategic Footprint: Directly influence the footprint of Qlik's AI products, contributing to a strategic investment in AI.
User-Centric Solutions: Collaborate with cross-functional teams to understand user requirements and implement impactful and user-friendly AI solutions.
Critical Functionality Delivery: Work with product design teams to deliver critical functionalities supporting our AI vision.
Technology Evaluation: Identify and evaluate new technologies, enhancing the performance, maintainability, and reliability of our machine learning systems.
Best Practices Application: Apply software engineering best practices, including CI/CD, automation, monitoring, and security.


We’re Looking For a Teammate With


Master's or Ph.D. in Computer Science, Machine Learning, Data Science, or a related field.
5+ years of experience building production-quality AI/ML software.
Programming proficiency in languages like Python, Golang, Java, C++.
Experience with structured data using popular machine learning libraries and frameworks (TensorFlow, PyTorch, scikit-learn).
Familiarity with foundational models like Llama, Falcon, OpenAI, Hugging Face, Mistral, etc.
3+ years of experience with cloud service providers (AWS, Azure, Google Cloud).
Expertise in working with unstructured data sources, including RAG, vector databases, knowledge graphs, grounding, prompt engineering, chain-of-thought, pre-training, and fine-tuning.
Familiarity with SQL programming and SQL/NoSQL databases (e.g., MongoDB, ElasticSearch).
Demonstrated ability to stay abreast of emerging trends and techniques in the field of AI.


The location for this role is:

Sweden - Lund or Stockholm

Join us at Qlik and shape the future of AI – your opportunity to make an impact is now!

More About Qlik And Who We Are

Find out more about life at Qlik on social: @LifeAtQlik, LinkedIn, YouTube, and X/Twitter, and to see all other opportunities to join us + our values, check out www.qlik.com/careers

What else do we offer?


Genuine career progression pathways and mentoring programs
Culture of innovation, technology, collaboration, and openness
Flexible, diverse, and international work environment


Giving back is a huge part of our culture. Alongside an extra “change the world” day plus another for personal development, we also highly encourage participation in our Corporate Responsibility Employee Programs

If you need assistance applying for a role due to a disability, please submit your request via [email protected]. Any information you provide will be treated according to Qlik’s Recruitment Privacy Notice. Qlik may only respond to emails related to accommodation requests.

Qlik is not accepting unsolicited assistance from search firms for this employment opportunity. Please, no phone calls or emails. All resumes submitted by search firms to any employee at Qlik via-email, the Internet or in any form and/or method without a valid written search agreement in place for this position will be deemed the sole property of Qlik. No fee will be paid in the event the candidate is hired by Qlik as a result of the referral or through other means.

- EMEA
Show more

Multicultural Environment: Be part of a multicultural and highly collaborative environment, contributing to a creative and team-oriented culture.

Pioneering Integration: Pioneer the combination of structured and unstructured data, unlocking new use cases and hidden insights.

Semantic Search Development: Build semantic search capabilities on our platform, translate natural language into analytic queries, and continuously improve AI responses based on user behaviour.

Here’s How You’ll Be Making An Impact

  • Strategic Footprint: Directly influence the footprint of Qlik's AI products, contributing to a strategic investment in AI.
  • User-Centric Solutions: Collaborate with cross-functional teams to understand user requirements and implement impactful and user-friendly AI solutions.
  • Critical Functionality Delivery: Work with product design teams to deliver critical functionalities supporting our AI vision.
  • Technology Evaluation: Identify and evaluate new technologies, enhancing the performance, maintainability, and reliability of our machine learning systems.
  • Best Practices Application: Apply software engineering best practices, including CI/CD, automation, monitoring, and security.

We’re Looking For a Teammate With

  • Master's or Ph.D. in Computer Science, Machine Learning, Data Science, or a related field.
  • 5+ years of experience building production-quality AI/ML software.
  • Programming proficiency in languages like Python, Golang, Java, C++.
  • Experience with structured data using popular machine learning libraries and frameworks (TensorFlow, PyTorch, scikit-learn).
  • Familiarity with foundational models like Llama, Falcon, OpenAI, Hugging Face, Mistral, etc.
  • 3+ years of experience with cloud service providers (AWS, Azure, Google Cloud).
  • Expertise in working with unstructured data sources, including RAG, vector databases, knowledge graphs, grounding, prompt engineering, chain-of-thought, pre-training, and fine-tuning.
  • Familiarity with SQL programming and SQL/NoSQL databases (e.g., MongoDB, ElasticSearch).
  • Demonstrated ability to stay abreast of emerging trends and techniques in the field of AI.

The location for this role is:

Sweden - Lund or Stockholm

Join us at Qlik and shape the future of AI – your opportunity to make an impact is now!

More About Qlik And Who We Are

Find out more about life at Qlik on social: @LifeAtQlik, LinkedIn, YouTube, and X/Twitter, and to see all other opportunities to join us + our values, check out www.qlik.com/careers

What else do we offer?

  • Genuine career progression pathways and mentoring programs
  • Culture of innovation, technology, collaboration, and openness
  • Flexible, diverse, and international work environment

Giving back is a huge part of our culture. Alongside an extra “change the world” day plus another for personal development, we also highly encourage participation in our Corporate Responsibility Employee Programs

If you need assistance applying for a role due to a disability, please submit your request via [email protected]. Any information you provide will be treated according to Qlik’s Recruitment Privacy Notice. Qlik may only respond to emails related to accommodation requests.

Qlik is not accepting unsolicited assistance from search firms for this employment opportunity. Please, no phone calls or emails. All resumes submitted by search firms to any employee at Qlik via-email, the Internet or in any form and/or method without a valid written search agreement in place for this position will be deemed the sole property of Qlik. No fee will be paid in the event the candidate is hired by Qlik as a result of the referral or through other means.

- EMEA

Title: Senior Data Scientist
Description:
BrightBid is a rapidly growing AdTech company using the best of AI and human expertise to create Google Ads recommendations for businesses and help drive customer acquisition. Combined with BrightBid’s marketing and sales expertise, its AI- and human-led offering enables companies to compete, seeing at least a 35% increase in results on average. Founded in 2020, BrightBid is well in the top 10% of the fastest-growing SaaS companies globally and has achieved over 500,000 conversions for its 400+ customers.




We are now looking for a Senior Data Scientist to join our team in Stockholm within the Data & AI team.




As a Senior Data Scientist at BrightBid, you will play a pivotal role in developing advanced algorithms and models to enhance and automate our platform further.




Responsibilities:

Design and implement ML algorithms to optimize ad targeting, bidding strategies, performance prediction.
Become a key contributor and tech lead for our Generative AI solutions in order to empower our Ad platform with powerful and relevant text automations at scale.
Lead the deployment of your models into production, ensuring scalability, reliability, and performance.
Conduct A/B testing and experimentation to validate the effectiveness of your models within relevant statistical frameworks.
Work closely with cross-functional teams, including Data Scientists, Data Engineers, Software Engineers, and Product Managers, to integrate our AI solutions seamlessly into our platform.
Stay up-to-date with the latest advancements and innovations in ML and Generative AI, ensuring BrightBid remains at the forefront of AI technologies.




What we are looking for:

In addition to an appetite to work with the above responsibilities, the ideal candidate will have a successful track record within at least some of the following areas:

4+ years in developing and deploying ML models in a production environment [required]
Good knowledge of software development practices such as versioning, CI/CD, etc. [required]
Proficiency with Python and standard ML libraries, algorithms and frameworks (Scikit-learn, PyTorch/Tensorflow).
Large Language Models (OpenAI’s GPT, LLaMA or other open-source or fine-tuned models) used at scale in a production environment.
Collaborative work in a fast-paced startup environment, contributing to a positive and innovative team culture.
AdTech, real-time bidding, or e-commerce companies.




Why BrightBid:

A fast-paced company with a yearly growth of 400% since its foundation.
We are open in 4 different markets: Stockholm, Copenhagen, Oslo and London.
Wellness allowance.
All the tools you need to succeed in this role, Macbooks, monitors and more if necessary!
Hybrid working place.
Afterworks and kickoffs with the team.
Free breakfast at the office.
A fantastic team with high energy!
Show more

Title: Scientific programmer
Description:
at the Department of Environmental Science. Closing date: 6 September 2024.

The Department of Environmental Science is one of the larger departments within the Faculty of Science. The department consists of four units with roughly 170 employed researchers, teachers, PhD students and technical/administrative staff from more than 30 different countries. Research and teaching are conducted in environmental chemistry, ecotoxicology, atmospheric science and biogeochemistry. As an employee at the Department of Environmental Science, you will be part of a dynamic environment with research of the highest class and with a strong international character. The Atmospheric Science Unit is now seeking a Scientific Programmer. The employment is co-financed with the Department of Meteorology (MISU), and is linked to two Wallenberg Academy Scholar projects at both departments. The recruited programmer will collaborate within the framework of the Bolin Center for Climate Research, which is an umbrella organization for climate-related research and collaboration at Stockholm University in collaboration with KTH and the Swedish Meteorological and Hydrological Institute (SMHI).

Main Responsibilities

The scientific programmer will support students and scientists at the unit and within the Bolin Centre in the development and application of numerical models used for studies of aerosols, clouds, and aerosol-cloud interactions. A particular focus will be on large-eddy simulations.

As a Scientific Programmer, You Will


Support with setup, execution, data management, and analysis of experiments with large-eddy simulation and cloud parcel models (or components of these models) within available computational facilities.
Maintain code versioning and assist in the development of individual system compartments.
Develop code for post-processing and archiving of modeling output.
Design optimal infrastructure for the modeling and data storage needs.
Assist in educational activities where aerosol and cloud microphysical models are used.


Qualification Requirements

We are looking for someone with at least an MSc degree in any quantitative science (e.g. physics, meteorology, mechanical engineering, fluid dynamics, applied mathematics, or computer science). The candidate must have good communication skills in English, both oral and written.

Demonstrated expertise in the following areas will be considered a merit:


Programming skills in FORTRAN and/or C/C++ in a UNIX system environment.
Practical knowledge of bash scripts and programming languages such as Python, MATLAB, or IDL.
Experience in scientific programming, software support, solving numerical problems, and running large eddy-simulation codes.
Working knowledge of climate model data formats (netCDF, GRIB) and data conversion and manipulation tools (e.g. CDO, NCO, GRIP_API).
Knowledge of High-Performance Computing (HPC) and parallel programming.
Knowledge of modern software engineering practices (source code management, testing, continuous integration, issue tracking, agile software development).


We seek a flexible and proactive person with a strong motivation to apply their expertise to large-eddy simulation, who is capable of independent thinking, likes to continuously learn about new scientific problems, and actively seeks solutions to these problems. A PhD in the above-mentioned fields of science is not mandatory but is considered a merit.

Terms of employment

This is a full-time, indefinite-term position with a six-month trial period. Salaries at Stockholm University are determined individually. Start date as agreed.

Stockholm University strives to be a workplace free from discrimination and with equal opportunities for all.

Contact

Further information about the position can be obtained from, Professor Ilona Riipinen, ilona.riipinen@aces.su.se, or Professor Annica Ekman, annica@misu.su.se.

Union representatives

Ingrid Lander (Saco-S), telephone: +46 708 16 26 64, saco@saco.su.se, Alejandra Pizarro Carrasco (Fackförbundet ST/OFR), telephone: +46 8 16 34 89, alejandra@st.su.se, and seko@seko.su.se (SEKO).

Application

Apply for the position at Stockholm University's recruitment system. It is the responsibility of the applicant to ensure that the application is complete in accordance with the instructions in the job advertisement, and that it is submitted before the deadline.

Only include the cover letter and CV in your application. Bring copies of grades and certificates if you are called to an interview.

The instructions for applicants are available at: How to apply for a position.

You are welcome to apply!

Stockholm University contributes to the development of sustainable democratic society through knowledge, enlightenment and the pursuit of truth.
Show more

Title: Software Engineer to Life Science start-up
Description:
Here you have the opportunity to be part of something special! We're on the lookout for a Software Engineer to join our partner and their passionate team of experts. If you're enthusiastic about breaking new ground and immersing yourself in cutting-edge technology within the research field, this is the opportunity you've been longing for. Seize the chance to be part of something extraordinary!

Apply here!


City :

Stockholm


Job Category :

Technology


Extent :

Full time, office hours


Start date :

As soon as possible


Type of work :

Staffing


Other :

Possibility to work remote


About the role



Our partner has rapidly expanded their business, achieving remarkable success in the field of Life Sciences. Picture yourself contributing to the development of a groundbreaking Life Science product that is set to redefine the industry. The start-up is a passionate organisation of approximately 50 individuals that work together in the development-phase with the mission to launch a cutting-edge Life Science product.




You will be part of a dedicated team composed of four experienced and talanted Software Engineers. Together you will collaborate in the early software development setting up the architecture and designing the the software related to the product and its hardware.





You are offered







A part of an organisation destined for greatness


Projects focused on new technologies and products


A dedicated Consultant Manager that cares about your personal och professional development



Work tasks




Designing and developing software, including hardware control and analysis SW


Participate in code reviews, create unit tests, and engage in various activities to ensure the development of high-quality software


Planning and executing software development projects


Work actively in the code base with Python



We are looking for




A candidate with a MsC in Software Engineering, Information Technology, Computer Science or similar


Work life experience of working with product development and embedded systems


Up-to-date programming skills in Python within Linux environment


Fluent in English both in writing and verbally since it is the language used with colleagues and customers






It is meritorious if you have







Experience of working with product development within the Life Science industry


Skills in DevOps and setting up CI/CD pipelines


Fluent in Swedish both in writing and verbally






To succeed in the role, your personal skills are:






You are communicative and collaborative, and you enjoy working in a goal-oriented environment and on projects with cross-functional teams. You have a proactive, entrepreneurial mindset and have a sense of urgency and have the tools to create and maintain a culture of innovation and excellence. It is important that you have strong teamwork skills and an analytical and pragmatic approach. You are friendly, positive, and fun to work with, and you enjoy working in a fast-paced, changing environment.



Our recruitment process




This recruitment process is handled by Academic Work and it is our client’s wish that all questions regarding the position is directed to Academic Work.




Our selection process is continuous and the advert may close before the recruitment process is completed if we have moved forward to the next phase. The process includes two tests: one personality test and one cognitive test. The tests are tools to find the right talent for the right position, to enable equality, diversity, and a fair process.


Become a part of Academic Work



When you apply to this job, you are becoming one of many consultants at Academic Work. This means that not only will you gain fantastic benefits, but also a team of consultant managers to support you through your career with us.

Read more about Academic Work
Do you have questions about this job?



Erik Gund or a colleague in the recruitment team will gladly answer you on sth4@academicwork.se Please specify advert-ID in your email: 15106278

Title: Junior Software Engineer
Description:
Position Type

Full time

Type Of Hire

Experienced (relevant combo of work and education)

Education Desired

Bachelor of Computer Science

Travel Percentage

0%

Junior Software Engineer

Location~ Stockholm, Sweden

FIS is a leading global provider of financial software that powers the world's economy. We are a diverse team of innovators who are passionate about creating cutting-edge fintech products and solutions for our clients and communities. We are committed to championing diversity and creating an inclusive workplace.

The FIS Cross-Asset Trading and Risk Platform (formerly Front Arena) helps firms quickly enter new markets and support new strategies. We deliver real-time controls for trading, order management, profit & loss and position keeping with risk management, all on one platform for both sell-side and buy-side.

Your role As a Junior Software Engineer in the Workflow team, you will be challenged with a wide range of tasks. You will be involved in the design, development, and maintenance of PRIME – a client application within the FIS Cross-Asset Trading and Risk Platform. The Workflow team is responsible for the development of trade entry frameworks and applications, workflows for life-cycle events and back-office operations. The development is typically done using C++, Python, and other native techniques.

We believe you are a Software Engineer with some experience in developing software in C or C++ (or equivalent). You are keen on taking responsibility for your own development. Your responsibilities will, besides development, include automated testing, support assistance and maintenance.

We will offer you stimulating challenges, where understanding customer requirements and solving problems is a key part, in combination with creating advanced technical solutions. You will be part of an agile team with skilled and motivated developers and QA that take full responsibility for its solution which includes both working on continuous improvements as well as innovations. We believe that the best solutions are built by those who are proud of what they produce! By working closely together with Senior Developers and the Product Owner in your Scrum team you will get a deep understanding of market needs and software design. Position requirements

We strongly believe that passion for financial markets and software development are equally necessary! We know that we can accomplish a lot more together than as individuals so are you a creative, passionate and a caring team player?

We Expect You To Have The Following


Master's degree in Computer Science, Mathematics, Engineering Physics, or similar degree
0-3 years of experience in system development
Understanding of Object-Oriented Programming
Experience with C/C++ and Python is an advantage
Knowledge and interest in financial mathematics
Have capacity to deliver high quality software in a high pace environment
Fluent English


In Addition To This We Believe That You


Like to take initiatives and influence the direction of your own development
Have strong analytical thinking with an attitude that problems are to be solved
Are communicative and strongly like to work in a team and share knowledge with others
Are not afraid of challenging your colleagues in their mindset
Have interest/experience in agile methodologies and software test automation


What we offer you At FIS, we offer you the opportunity to shape the future of fintech. You will be part of an expansive phase

In Our Continued Journey. We Believe In Creating a Workplace Where Ideas Can Flow Freely And Where Every Day Is Different. A Career At FIS Is More Than Just a Job. We Offer


A multifaceted job with a high degree of responsibility and a broad spectrum of opportunities
The chance to work on some of the most challenging, relevant issues in financial services and technology
A voice in the future of one of the World's largest Fintech organizations
An informal and inclusive culture where we 'Win as a team' and care for each other
A flexible work-life where we embrace the mix of working digitally and from the office
Competitive salary and benefits package


Privacy Statement

FIS is committed to protecting the privacy and security of all personal information that we process in order to provide services to our clients. For specific information on how FIS protects personal information online, please see the Online Privacy Notice .

Sourcing Model

Recruitment at FIS works primarily on a direct sourcing model; a relatively small portion of our hiring is through recruitment agencies. FIS does not accept resumes from recruitment agencies which are not on the preferred supplier list and is not responsible for any related fees for resumes submitted to job postings, our employees, or any other part of our company.

#pridepass

Title: UI Engineer - AI/Machine Learning Integration
Description:
Do you love building user interfaces that bring complex data to life? Are you passionate about machine learning and its potential to revolutionise user experiences? If so, then we want to hear from you!

We are seeking a talented UI Engineer to join our team and play a pivotal role in integrating our cutting-edge machine learning models with our core SaaS platform. You will be responsible for translating model outputs into clear, actionable insights through a visually appealing and intuitive user interface.

We have the data - come work with us!

The world is changing in the way we consume products, from ownership to usership, and DigitalRoute is positioned in the centre of the transition. Because, when enterprises pivot to usage-based business models, they often make an unfortunate discovery. Their systems weren’t built to handle the massive data volumes and complexity that usage-based models generate. This causes them to leak revenue and respond too slowly to customer demand. DigitalRoute solves this by creating a real-time usage data layer for enterprises. Our products transform raw usage data into clear information for billing, in real time and at high scale.

At DigitalRoute we are shifting our focus from moving data at scale to delivering new insight and value out of the data we process. We call this Usage Intelligence: anomaly detection, usage forecasting, churn prediction, etc.. This new value creation heavily relies on artificial intelligence and machine learning techniques.

What You'll Do


Collaborate with Product Managers and Data Scientists to understand machine learning model functionalities and outputs.
Design and develop user interfaces for integrating machine learning model APIs with the existing SaaS platform.
Translate complex model results into clear and actionable visualizations using dashboards and other UI elements.
Ensure seamless integration with the platform's native UI and user experience for a cohesive feel.
Write clean, efficient, and maintainable code using modern front-end technologies (HTML, CSS, JavaScript).
Conduct thorough testing across different browsers and devices to ensure optimal performance.
Stay up-to-date with the latest trends and advancements in UI/UX design and machine learning visualization techniques.


What You'll Bring


3+ years of experience as a UI Engineer or in a similar front-end development role.
Proven ability to design and develop user interfaces that are both visually appealing and user-friendly.
Self-driven, opinionated, and autonomous work ethic.
Strong understanding of HTML, CSS, and JavaScript (including frameworks like React, Node).
Experience with integrating APIs and data visualization libraries.
Familiarity with machine learning concepts and a passion for its potential applications.
Excellent communication and collaboration skills to work effectively with cross-functional teams.
A meticulous eye for detail and a commitment to writing clean and well-documented code.
Experience with GitHub and GitHub CI/CD processes.
Experience with building dashboards and data visualization tools.
Knowledge of accessibility best practices.
Understanding of SaaS development principles and familiarity with at least one of the major cloud platforms (AWS, GCP, Azure, OCI)


We apply continuous selection, and the position may be filled before the last application date.

DigitalRoute wants to be part of an inclusive and diverse environment and we are actively looking for qualified candidates irrespective of gender, sexual orientation, ethnicity, disability, or age. You will be part of a global and diverse company where our differences are our strengths.

We offer a competitive salary and benefits package, along with the opportunity to work on cutting-edge technology that is making a real impact. If you are a talented UI Engineer who is excited to push the boundaries of human-machine interaction, then we encourage you to apply!
Show more

Title: Junior Software Engineer
Description:
Position Type

Full time

Type Of Hire

Experienced (relevant combo of work and education)

Education Desired

Bachelor of Computer Engineering

Travel Percentage

0%

FIS is a leading global provider of financial software that powers the world's economy. We are a diverse team of innovators who are passionate about creating cutting-edge fintech products and solutions for our clients and communities. We are committed to championing diversity and creating an inclusive workplace.

The FIS Cross-Asset Trading and Risk solution helps firms quickly enter new markets and support new strategies. We deliver real-time controls for trading, order management, profit & loss and position keeping with risk management, all on one platform for both sell-side and buy-side.

About The Role

As a developer in our Market Integration team you will be challenged with a wide range of tasks, ranging from design, development and maintenance of our solution. The Market Integration team is responsible for the integration solution to exchanges globally as well as integration to alternative trading platforms and broker networks. The solution is based on back-end modules with very demanding requirements on low latency as well as high throughput. We have a test-driven development process, and the development is done with in-house developed frameworks using UML, pre-processing and a C like mapping language in parallel with standard C++ and Python.

We will offer you challenges, where understanding market and customer requirements and solving problems is a key part, in combination with creating advanced technical solutions. You will be part of an Agile Scrum team with skilled and motivated developers and QA that take full responsibility for its solution which includes both working on continuous improvements as well as innovations. By working closely together with Senior Developers and the Product Owner in your Scrum team you will get a deep understanding of market needs.

Position Requirements

We expect you to have the following~


M Sc. in Computer Science, Engineering Physics or similar degree.
Experience in an object-oriented language like Python or C++ is a plus.
A great interest in learning the financial markets.
Have capacity to deliver high quality software in a high pace environment.
Good skills in English.


In Addition To This We Believe That You


Have knowledge about tools like Jira, GitHub, containerization tools.
Like to take initiatives and influence the direction of your own development.
Have strong analytical thinking with an attitude that problems are to be solved.
Are communicative and strongly like to work in a team and share knowledge with others.
Are not afraid of challenging your colleagues in their mindset.


What We Offer You

At FIS, we offer you the opportunity to shape the future of fintech. You will be part of an expansive phase in our continued journey. We believe in creating a workplace where ideas can flow freely and where every day is different. A career at FIS is more than just a job. We offer~


A flexible work-life where we embrace the mix of working digitally and from the office
A broad range of professional education and personal development possibilities
A work environment built on collaboration, flexibility and respect
The chance to work on some of the most challenging, relevant issues in financial services and technology
A voice in the future of one of the World's largest Fintech organizations


Privacy Statement

FIS is committed to protecting the privacy and security of all personal information that we process in order to provide services to our clients. For specific information on how FIS protects personal information online, please see the Online Privacy Notice .

Sourcing Model

Recruitment at FIS works primarily on a direct sourcing model; a relatively small portion of our hiring is through recruitment agencies. FIS does not accept resumes from recruitment agencies which are not on the preferred supplier list and is not responsible for any related fees for resumes submitted to job postings, our employees, or any other part of our company.

#pridepass

Title: Data Scientist to a startup within mobile games
Description:
Our client is a Mobile Games studio in Stockholm, and is looking for an experienced Data Scientist who likes to tinker with data engineering and analytics.




Responsibilities:




Develop and Manage Databases: Design and maintain databases and data warehouses, ensuring efficient storage, retrieval, and data integrity.
Performance Optimization: Optimize database performance through indexing, query optimization, and regular maintenance.
Data Cleaning and Preprocessing: Clean and preprocess raw data to ensure quality and suitability for analysis, effectively handling missing data, outliers, and other data quality issues.
Model Performance Monitoring: Continuously monitor model performance, making necessary adjustments to maintain accuracy and relevance over time.
Data Visualization: Create compelling data visualizations and dashboards to present data insights clearly and effectively.
Communication of Complex Data: Use visualization tools to facilitate the understanding and communication of complex data.
Data Analysis: Analyze large datasets to extract actionable insights, identifying trends, patterns, and correlations that inform strategic decisions.




About You

We believe you have a background in data engineering and analytics within the gaming industry and have a passion for mobile games.




Requirements:




SQL Proficiency: Expert in SQL for querying and managing relational databases.
Google BigQuery Expertise: Experienced in using Google BigQuery for data warehousing, including understanding its SQL dialect and optimization techniques.
Scalable Database Solutions: Knowledgeable in creating distributed and scalable database solutions.
ETL Pipelines: Experienced in developing and managing ETL pipelines for data ingestion, processing, and transformation.
Statistical Analysis and Data Mining: Skilled in statistical analysis and data mining techniques to uncover insights from large datasets.
Dashboard Development: Proficient in building dashboards and supporting self-sufficient data models.
Cross-Functional Collaboration: Experience working in cross-functional teams, providing data insights to support product improvements.




Their office is located in central Stockholm, and they all work on-site. They are looking for someone who wants to do the same.

Title: Senior Data Scientist, Learning
Description:
We are looking for an entrepreneurial and business minded senior data scientist to join the band to help explore and execute on learning as a new opportunity for Spotify. It is a phenomenal role for someone who wants to work on a truly 0 to 1 project and have an impact on the company's growth trajectory!

As a data scientist in this team you’d partner with the full cross-functional team to help with research, data modeling and data-informed decision making related to building the product and driving impact for users, creators and the business. This is a fantastic opportunity to join our fast-paced team where you’ll get the chance to wear multiple hats and contribute to the product research and business analytics efforts to help craft and execute the product roadmap.

What You Are


Help build out the insights foundations that will allow us to gather conclusive evidence on the trajectory and viability of learning as an opportunity for Spotify. This includes instrumentation all the way through to analysis as well as understanding the learning space from multiple angles such as user, UX, content, marketing, creator and business perspectives to help inform decision making.
Develop business intelligence-, growth model- and product metrics framework.
Perform analysis on large sets of internal data to extract practical insights that will help drive product, platform and business decisions.
Design and conduct A/B tests to generate insights and drive impact across the entire learning product.
Build dashboards, data pipelines, and recurring reporting results, empowering business and product decision making
Develop models which power on- and off-platform promotion of learning based content
Help develop interest graph and content demand models for the content powering ML recommendations for users
Communicate data-driven insights and recommendations to key partners
Work closely and embedded with cross-functional team including engineering, product, design and business decision makers


Where You'll Do


You believe that Spotify can truly create an impact in the learning space and have a point of view on that.
You care end to end about the product, the implementation, the design, the creators, the business, and you are ready to wear multiple hats to achieve your goals.
You have experience in a data science role in a related field and expertise in science, computer science, statistics, economics, mathematics, or similar quantitative subject area.
You have experience with business intelligence, product analytics and complex data-driven decision making.
You have broad experience performing analysis with large datasets and strong understanding of experimentation, statistics and machine learning for decision making.
You value cross-disciplinary work and understand how to match qualitative research with your quantitative analysis.
You take pride in your ability to identify and solve complex, unfamiliar problems, and present them to the rest of the team.
You have a growth mindset, are curious and not afraid to be experimental. You share your ideas and continuously improve yourself and the team around you.
You have excellent skills across the data science stack including Python, SQL and visualization tools (we primarily use Jupyter notebooks, BigQuery and Tableau)


Where You'll Be


The team is distributed across the CET region with most people located in Stockholm and London.


#JobSite-Main-DataResearchAndInsights

#JobSite-Sub-DataScience

#HireRight Sweden Package

Today, we are the world’s most popular audio streaming subscription service.

Title: Machine Learning Engineer – Data & Analytics at SEB in Stockholm
Description:
SEB is more than just a bank with an IT function. We are a progressive tech company powered by innovation and fueled by collaboration. From Java to AI and everything in between, we offer you an impressive tech stack and several technology paths. Together we're innovating for a sustainable society and building the tech arena of the future, a welcoming space for everyone.

We are looking for a Machine Learning Engineer to strengthen our team in Stockholm, working with our scalable Advanced Analytics products.

About The Job

We are working together with our colleagues from different parts of SEB to provide advanced analytics to all at SEB. Our team consists of world-class Data Scientists and Machine Learning Engineers. Together we design, develop and deploy ML models to GCP and deliver value from data and analytics.

Together, we will increase the frequency of finding valuable insights within our data in the bank waiting to be found. Our team is dedicated to making data science and machine learning accessible by creating user-friendly, secure and governed tools that standardize the ways of working.

We belong to the SEB Data & Analytics tribe, an international environment with multiple agile development teams working in an enterprise superset of scrum located in Stockholm and Vilnius, consisting of experts in various Big Data and Advanced Analytics technologies.

Who are you?

We are looking for an engineer with system operations experience and an interest in system development and machine learning.

You and your fellow team members will create and maintain products in the Advanced Analytics team, together with data scientists and other internal customers.

If you are analytical, curious and have a passion for problem-solving and discovering new ways of working, you will enjoy it here. Especially if you also like Swedish fika!

Required Skills


A degree in engineering, computer or data science, or equivalent work experience
Experience from designing, implementing and deploying ML models
Experience from working in Linux environments
Programming and scripting skills (e.g. Python and bash scripting)
Experience in developing services (e.g. REST APIs)
Collaboration skills and a high sense of responsibility. We always work and deliver as a team, and the ability to share knowledge and experience is fundamental.
Well-versed in matters of IT security
Automation and configuration management systems (e.g. Ansible, Terraform, Chef)
Cloud technologies, such as GCP
CI/CD, such as GitHub Actions or GitLab pipelines


Nice-to-have


Programming skills in Java and Scala
Experience in working with container orchestration (e.g. Docker, Kubernetes, OpenShift).
Data engineering experience, e.g. Apache Spark
Database knowledge (RDBMS and/or NoSQL)
Knowledge of authentication and authorization services (e.g. Kerberos, LDAP, OAuth 2.0)


Learn More About Working At SEB At Www.sebgroup.com/career

It is our fundamental belief that inclusion and diversity are crucial for our future success. We strive to have an inclusive, value-driven culture where employees feel valued, respected and involved irrespective of who they are, what they believe or where they come from.

Great people often know great people – please share if you have a friend who would love this job.

Welcome with your application

Attach your CV and a personal letter describing yourself and how you can contributeto our journey. We will contact candidates on a running basis, feel free to send in your application today, but no later than 2024-08-31. Please note that due to the summer holiday season, responses might take a bit longer.

If you have questions about the position, please contact Dina Dervisevic, EngineeringManager – Advanced Analytics and Data Services, at dina.dervisevic@seb.se

SEB Sweden has a redeployment responsibility, why this position might be covered by internal redeployment.

Title: Senior Data Scientist (Analytics), Courier & Logistics
Description:
Job Description

We are looking for a Senior Data Scientist to join Wolt’s Courier & Logistics mission!

As the international side of Doordash business, Wolt is active in 27 countries outside of the US and growing. Together with functional and cross-functional partners, you’ll tackle highly impactful challenges to craft the most-loved platform for gig workers, empower local businesses with our robust logistics system. Ultimately, your efforts will connect consumers to everything they desire.

About The Role

Are you a creative thinker who thrives on turning ambiguous problems into business solutions? As a Data Scientist at Wolt, you’ll dive deep into our data to tackle crucial business challenges. You will diagnose problem areas, develop new metrics, design experiments, uncover foundational causal relationships in our data, and influence strategic decisions. This role combines scientific expertise with stakeholder engagement, positioning you at the forefront of driving business outcomes.

We’re seeking someone who enjoys finding patterns amidst chaos, is excited to build solutions from the ground up, and has a proven track record in using data science to solve business problems. You will work closely with Product, Engineering, Design, and Operations teams to guide measurement strategies and tactical decisions, helping to expand the Wolt platform globally. If you take ownership of business outcomes and are proactive in driving change, we want you on our team!

Our offering to you


The online delivery platform that Wolt is building will offer you interesting and complex challenges together with the opportunities to create a big impact with your skills. Lots of geolocational and temporal data in real-time combined with differences in the economics and dynamics of the cities we operate in make Wolt both a challenging and so interesting company to practice analytics.
You can choose the location from our tech hubs in Berlin, Helsinki and Stockholm, or you can work entirely remotely anywhere in Germany, Finland and Sweden. You have the chance to decide the ways of working — a hybrid, at the office, or remote within the location above. 💙 Read more about our remote setup.
You would get to work in a company culture where we take ownership beyond the obvious, do common things uncommonly well, we think big but stay humble, do right by people, we treat others kindly and justly, recognize that if we don’t learn, we won’t stay still but fall behind. Read more about how we work.


Our humble expectations


Degree in Mathematics, Statistics, Computer Science, or a related field.
Have over 5 years of experience in a data science or analytics position within an industry or research setting.
Expertise in statistical analysis, including hypothesis testing, experimentation, and regression analysis using statistical software packages in Python, Matlab, R, or equivalent.
Expertise in causal inference and quasi-experimentation.
Proficiency in writing structured and efficient SQL queries for large data sets.
Relentless pursuit of new ideas and data sources, and the ability to systematically tackle ambiguous problems with a data-driven, hypothesis-based approach.
Be analytical, inquisitive, and a self-starter who is motivated to achieve results and collaborate with colleagues both inside and outside of the team.


Next Steps

The position will be filled as soon as we find the right person, so make sure to apply as soon as you realize you really, really want to join us!

The compensation will be a negotiable combination of monthly pay and DoorDash RSUs. The latter makes it exceptionally easy to be excited about our company growing and doing well, as you’ll own a piece of the pie.

For any further questions about the position, you can turn to Product+ Talent Acquisition Partner - Zhanna Filintseva (zhanna.filintseva@wolt.com)

About Wolt

Wolt is a technology company that makes it incredibly easy to discover and get the best restaurants, grocery stores and other local shops delivered to your home or office. Wolt is not just a delivery app – we’re a technology company building a commerce platform to seamlessly connect our millions of customers with thousands of merchant and courier partners, in real-time across 23 countries and 250+ cities. Our apps (iOS and Android) have the industry’s highest ratings, largely thanks to our customer-first-mindset, which shows in how we build products and run operations. In June 2022 we officially joined forces with DoorDash. Combined, we have a presence in 27 countries, 23 of which operate with the Wolt brand and app. Wolt and DoorDash continue largely independently, with Wolt’s name, brand, product, technology and team.

Working in Product Development at Wolt

At Wolt, we’re about getting things done. You’ll probably enjoy it here if you like taking ownership, developing yourself and being around friendly, humble and ambitious people.

The behind the scenes of Wolt is run by an awesome bunch of over 400+ planners, builders, designers and data crunchers. We call ourselves Product+, as we’re the very core of Wolt’s products, tools and platforms. To build our products, we work in over 40 cross-functional, independent and autonomous teams. Teams are made up of a mix of talented individuals: engineers, designers, data scientists, analysts, and product leads. Each team takes ownership for solving customer problems in the best possible way.

Our Commitment to Diversity, Equity & Inclusion

We want to have all sorts of people in our team – people like you and me, and people different from you and me. To be able to work with diverse teammates – when it comes to gender, age, ethnicity, life background, sexual orientation, political views, religion, or any other personal trait – we consciously aim to offer equal opportunity for everyone to work with us. This is because we believe diverse teams make the most thought-through decisions and build things in the most inclusive way.

Join us today to build Wolt together!


Show more
HTML:
Job Description

We are looking for a Senior Data Scientist to join Wolt’s Courier & Logistics mission!

As the international side of Doordash business, Wolt is active in 27 countries outside of the US and growing. Together with functional and cross-functional partners, you’ll tackle highly impactful challenges to craft the most-loved platform for gig workers, empower local businesses with our robust logistics system. Ultimately, your efforts will connect consumers to everything they desire.

About The Role

Are you a creative thinker who thrives on turning ambiguous problems into business solutions? As a Data Scientist at Wolt, you’ll dive deep into our data to tackle crucial business challenges. You will diagnose problem areas, develop new metrics, design experiments, uncover foundational causal relationships in our data, and influence strategic decisions. This role combines scientific expertise with stakeholder engagement, positioning you at the forefront of driving business outcomes.

We’re seeking someone who enjoys finding patterns amidst chaos, is excited to build solutions from the ground up, and has a proven track record in using data science to solve business problems. You will work closely with Product, Engineering, Design, and Operations teams to guide measurement strategies and tactical decisions, helping to expand the Wolt platform globally. If you take ownership of business outcomes and are proactive in driving change, we want you on our team!

Our offering to you

  • The online delivery platform that Wolt is building will offer you interesting and complex challenges together with the opportunities to create a big impact with your skills. Lots of geolocational and temporal data in real-time combined with differences in the economics and dynamics of the cities we operate in make Wolt both a challenging and so interesting company to practice analytics.
  • You can choose the location from our tech hubs in Berlin, Helsinki and Stockholm, or you can work entirely remotely anywhere in Germany, Finland and Sweden. You have the chance to decide the ways of working — a hybrid, at the office, or remote within the location above. 💙 Read more about our remote setup.
  • You would get to work in a company culture where we take ownership beyond the obvious, do common things uncommonly well, we think big but stay humble, do right by people, we treat others kindly and justly, recognize that if we don’t learn, we won’t stay still but fall behind. Read more about how we work.

Our humble expectations

  • Degree in Mathematics, Statistics, Computer Science, or a related field.
  • Have over 5 years of experience in a data science or analytics position within an industry or research setting.
  • Expertise in statistical analysis, including hypothesis testing, experimentation, and regression analysis using statistical software packages in Python, Matlab, R, or equivalent.
  • Expertise in causal inference and quasi-experimentation.
  • Proficiency in writing structured and efficient SQL queries for large data sets.
  • Relentless pursuit of new ideas and data sources, and the ability to systematically tackle ambiguous problems with a data-driven, hypothesis-based approach.
  • Be analytical, inquisitive, and a self-starter who is motivated to achieve results and collaborate with colleagues both inside and outside of the team.

Next Steps

The position will be filled as soon as we find the right person, so make sure to apply as soon as you realize you really, really want to join us!

The compensation will be a negotiable combination of monthly pay and DoorDash RSUs. The latter makes it exceptionally easy to be excited about our company growing and doing well, as you’ll own a piece of the pie.
