Title: Machine Learning Engineer
Description:
Stealth mode AI start-up

We are looking for a highly skilled Machine Learning Engineer to join a dynamic founding team within a super early stage stealth mode AI start-up. The role will be working on building agents, experimenting with different agent setups and contributing to overall architecture and design.

We are looking for someone with a passion for LLMs and multimodal generative Ai, who is a self-starter, and keen to build 0-1 products.




Qualifications:

Experience leveraging models like GPT-4 to build agents, leveraging techniques like prompt-engineering, tool-use, and image processing.
Self-starter with a passion for building new products.
A scrappy, hands-on approach to problem-solving.
Full-stack development is preferred




Bonus Qualifications:

Experience as a founder or early engineer at a start-up, having built a product from the ground up.
Experience with Retrieval-Augmented Generation (RAG) systems, and agents.

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
Respectfully, please DO NOT apply if your experience has not been gained working on biological data.




We are looking for an exceptional Data Scientist to drive the development of innovative AI and ML solutions for biomarker discovery, drug response prediction, and clinical decision-making support. This role offers a unique opportunity to leverage AI/ML technologies to enhance cancer patient outcomes.




This position requires a strong foundation in traditional statistical methods and expert knowledge of ML methodologies to analyse complex LC-MS/MS-derived datasets.




Collaborating closely with wet lab and bioinformatics teams, you will play a pivotal role in establishing a new precision medicine approach, aiming to create a single test predictive of a patient’s response to various therapies.




Are you experienced in Machine Learning (ML) and Deep-Learning (DL) methods, with over 5 years of expertise? This role involves applying various ML approaches to complex molecular and clinical data for biomarker discovery. Additionally, proficiency in a cloud platform like GCP, AWS, or Azure is key, along with experience in source control and software lifecycle management.




If you have a strong track record in structured problem-solving within interdisciplinary settings and a solid understanding of biochemical and molecular biological systems, this could be the perfect fit for you. A passion for mentoring and supporting colleagues, especially in ML best-practices, is highly valued.




We are looking ideally for individuals with expertise in Bayesian statistical methods, bioinformatics pipelines for proteomics data analysis, and experience in regulated environments. If you have a PhD or equivalent experience in these fields and are fluent in R, Python, or C++ and passionate about applying data science to revolutionise precision medicine and drive significant advancements in cancer treatment, this is an exciting opportunity to make a meaningful impact in the field.

Onsite/hybrid/remote options available.

Show more

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
Data Science, Financial Data, Python, Building Models

Who are we and why do we do what we do?

We are a data and payments company on a mission! We’re a group of developers, financial experts, and optimists who share a vision for improving the financial wellness of people, their businesses, and their communities.

We started this company with the aim of changing how the industry used and viewed data. As architects of Open Banking, Open Finance, and Open Data, we strive to be a force for good — changing the status quo of how businesses interact with people. We strive to serve the whole population through every change in their finances.

We do this by powering businesses through our APIs and Personal Finance Tech solutions as well as our own personal financial management app for consumers.

We can only do that by being an inclusive and diverse organisation. We invest in our people, and enjoy an environment focused on innovation, collaboration and openness.

What do we offer?

We champion flexibility, and we trust and respect our employees to deliver results in a way that best suits them, working around their own lives and commitments.

We live and breathe a fantastic culture of remote working and you may perform your duties predominantly from your home. However, the heart of Moneyhub is in Bristol and from time to time you will be required to attend company meet ups. Your role may require you to attend client meetings, networking events or group training sessions. You may also be required to work at such other place or places as we may reasonably require from time to time. As a minimum, you will be required to attend a quarterly All Team Away Day at a location of our choice (including overseas).

As well as a truly flexible approach, we also offer a fantastic range of benefits, including:

Remote working - with quarterly away days, regular team meeting and face to face client meetings as required.

10% contribution towards your Pension from your very first day with us;

25 days of holiday (plus bank hols), rising to 30 days after two years;

Choose to take your entitlement to UK bank holidays at other times based on your own days of significance;

Private medical insurance, including cover for pre-existing conditions, plus dental and optical benefit;

Six week Moneyhubber Family Pay when you become a new parent;

Permanent health insurance and life cover - much greater than the industry standard (death in service);

Employee assistance programme;

Professional development support, with dedicated allowance of time and money;

Life event leave;

Cycle to work scheme;

EV Salary sacrifice scheme;

£750 towards professional memberships

Remote working benefits, including work from almost anywhere, access to co-working spaces and support for your home office set-up

High spec laptop

Requirements

Sounds great right? What will you be doing?

The Data Science capability at Moneyhub generates value from a rich repository of data sources. Its function is critical to the day-to-day running of the business, and it also spearheads the development of novel ideas to exploit new commercial opportunities.

You Can Expect To Work On


The Machine Learning based transaction categorisation engine that underpins the budgeting capabilities of the app and affordability checking, e.g. for mortgages.
Data Science oriented product development: identifying improvements to existing algorithms, or the creation of new products using a quantitative approach. Examples: identifying regular payments from raw transaction data, geotagging banking transactions from their descriptions, reverse engineering credit card APRs.
Analysis of the characteristics of the user base, i.e. user segmentation, to support business decisions. For instance, what’s the current financial situation of the users of the app, what are their goals and how should the product be developed to aid the user in their journey?


About you


Have 3 or more years of experience as a Data Scientist.
Be fluent writing code in Python and queries in SQL. We use Jupyter notebooks, Python and Pandas frequently for analysis.
Understand a wide range of classification/regression algorithms and have applied them using libraries such as scikit-learn.
Have implemented regression analysis and understand how to interpret the results. More generally, you know how to apply appropriate statistical techniques to assess the significance of results.#
Be able to take raw data sets and build narratives around insights you discover;
Be comfortable using a variety of approaches to present results in a way a non-technical audience can understand and act on.
Appreciate the importance of data cleaning and have previously applied a range of approaches to achieve this.
Have a bachelor's or master’s degree in a numerical or engineering subject such as Data Science, Mathematics or Computer Science.
Show more

  • Appreciate the importance of data cleaning and have previously applied a range of approaches to achieve this.
  • Have a bachelor's or master’s degree in a numerical or engineering subject such as Data Science, Mathematics or Computer Science.

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
Our client is a global leader in food & beverage consumer trends, specializing in sustainable, natural, and plant-based ingredients and solutions. Catering to large, attractive, and rapidly growing end-use categories, they generated an impressive £12 billion in revenue last year. They are currently seeking a Data Scientist to join their team in London.




Work Arrangement: Hybrid (2 days in the office)

Sponsorship: Not available

Perks: Fancy lunch and drinks on Fridays

Salary: From £70k - £120k+

Interview Process: 2 rounds with no coding tests involved




Key Responsibilities:




Maintain and develop the Value-at-Risk (VaR) model for commodity and currency exposures using Python.
Develop a user interface for end-users.
Engage with Business Unit stakeholders to understand needs and scope risk-related projects.
Perform data analysis and visualization to identify patterns and insights in traded markets and positions.
Apply and refine analytical/machine learning models to solve business problems.
Implement and communicate model results and visualizations to drive business value.




Ideal Candidate:




STEM degree with strong coding skills.
3+ years of data science experience with real-world data.
Proficient in Python, SQL, and other data science tools.
Strong understanding of VaR modeling, stress testing, and financial derivatives.
Experience in time series modeling.
Skilled in visualizing complex data for diverse audiences.
Advanced qualifications in mathematics, statistics, and machine learning preferred.

Show more

  • 3+ years of data science experience with real-world data.
  • Proficient in Python, SQL, and other data science tools.
  • Strong understanding of VaR modeling, stress testing, and financial derivatives.
  • Experience in time series modeling.
  • Skilled in visualizing complex data for diverse audiences.
  • Advanced qualifications in mathematics, statistics, and machine learning preferred.

Description:
Software Engineer | .NET | up to £75k + bonus | SportTech ⚽️ 🏀 🏈 ⚾️ 🎾 🏐 🏉




About the business

📍Flexible working. Work remote first or from the Leeds or London office

📍35 hour working week


Skills needed

📍Strong experience in microservices, web-apis and message brokers

📍Experience with Cloud platforms (AWS, Azure, GCP)

📍Experience designing software under consideration of various aspects (like scalability, performance etc)


Software Engineer | .NET | up to £75k + bonus | SportTech ⚽️ 🏀 🏈 ⚾️ 🎾 🏐 🏉

Title: Ruby on Rails Developer
Description:
Ruby on Rails Developer - Remote (UK Based)

£50,000 - £60,000 + Excellent benefits

This profitable and well-established organisation are looking to add an experienced Ruby on Rails Developer to their in-house development team. In this role, you will be responsible for development of both the front end and API areas of a health-tech application.

As a Ruby on Rails Developer, you’ll be developing new features and contributing towards the roadmap delivery whilst also supporting legacy applications and operating within an Agile delivery environment.

This company operate a fully remote working model for UK based candidates, with occasional in-person meetings. They have worked this way for a number of years, encouraging regular communication, collaboration and teamwork.

Package:

£50,000 - £60,000 basic salary with yearly reviews

25 days holidays + bank holidays (rising to 30 days with service)

Life assurance, EAP, Private medical, shared parental leave and more.

Clear progression route and development opportunities

Key Requirements:

Ruby & Ruby on Rails

PostgreSQL

Front end development with either Svelte, Vue, React, etc.

Svelte, Heroku, API Development, Tailwind, TypeScript - desirable

Agile

The company offer excellent career opportunities and are interviewing immediately so please send your CV for consideration. All interviews will be conducted virtually, with the process aiming to be turned around quickly.

Erin Associates Ltd is acting as an Employment Agency in relation to this vacancy.

Please follow us on twitter @erinassociates or visit our website for similar roles.

If you have not heard back from us within 5 working days, please assume that your application has been unsuccessful on this occasion. Your profile may be considered for other suitable vacancies that arise within the next 12 weeks.

Contact - Scott Murray

Erin Associates welcomes applications from people of all ethnicities, genders, sexual orientations, and disabilities. Please inform us if you require any reasonable adjustment at any stage of the application process.

Ruby on Rails Developer, Full Stack Developer, Ruby Engineer - Hull, Leeds, York, Bradford, Sheffield, Manchester, Liverpool, Cambridge, Oxford, Newcastle, Bristol, Cardiff, Glasgow, Birmingham, Leicester, Nottingham, Bath, Kent, Edinburgh

Title: Applications Engineer
Description:
Posted by: TAMALO Solutions Ltd - HVACR, BMS & Process Cooling

Job title: Applications Engineer


Location: West Yorkshire

Sector Focus: HVAC Solutions & Precision Cooling

Package: Circa £40k + Superb Benefits

Your future employer:

At the forefront of cooling solutions, our client stands as a pioneering force in the HVAC industry. With a rich history of innovation and a commitment to excellence, they lead the way in providing cutting-edge solutions in a highly competitive sector. Joining this company means becoming a part of a dynamic team that thrives on innovation and pushing the boundaries of what's possible.

The Opportunity:

You’re invited to seize the opportunity as an Applications Engineer. Reporting to the Applications Engineering Team Leader, you'll play a vital role in supporting the sales team's growth and contributing to the success of their projects.

The Role:

As an Applications Engineer, you will:


Elevate the sales team's effectiveness by providing quotes and delivering precise order information for customer services and manufacturing.
Showcase your expertise in handling customer technical sales inquiries with finesse.
Collaborate closely with the external sales team, offering valuable support to drive success.
Swiftly respond to external sales inquiries, demonstrating your agility and responsiveness.
Provide comprehensive order details to ensure seamless processes for customer services and manufacturing.
Engage with third-party suppliers during the specification stage, fostering effective collaborations.


Skills/Experience:

To excel in this role, you should bring:


Engineering knowledge at a minimum of HND or degree level.
The ability to navigate and collaborate seamlessly with diverse groups within the dynamic landscape of a large manufacturing company.
Exceptional problem-solving skills, enabling you to overcome challenges and obstacles with ease.
Outstanding interpersonal skills for effective communication and collaboration.
Proactive initiative-taking capabilities, contributing to a culture of continuous improvement.
Excellent communication skills, allowing you to convey complex technical details with clarity and precision.


Why work here?

At my client’s company, they believe in fostering a culture that values talent, innovation, and professional growth. As a global player in the HVAC industry, they offer exciting projects and a collaborative environment where you can contribute to shaping the future of cooling solutions.

Do your future-self a favour, get in touch to hear more about this genuinely top notch opportunity.

TAMALO Solutions Ltd: Bespoke, exclusive & retained, technical & mid-senior level executive recruitment across HVACR, BMS & Process Cooling/ Heating Sectors. Our expertise in bespoke and specialised recruitment enables us to provide practical advice and ideal access to hidden client vacancies.

Apply for this opportunity by sending your CV with ref #(phone number removed) via the 'Apply Now' button. For a confidential chat, contact Owen on (phone number removed). We aim to keep you informed of your application status within 14 days; however, due to high volume, no response within this timeframe may indicate an unsuccessful application

Title: Controls Software Engineer
Description:
As part of the growth of the Airedale Controls Department an exciting opportunity has arisen for enthusiastic candidate to join the team. The role is to support the delivery of all software based solutions. As part of the software team you will be involved from conception to project completion gaining valuable experiences along the way.




Job Requirements

Design and code control systems strategies for HVAC applications using Carel, Trend, Tridium Niagara and Siemens controls platforms.
Test software using functional test simulators to ensure correct operation.
Produce project documentation including control philosophies, O&M manuals, functional test scripts and BMS points lists.
Site commissioning of controls projects and system integration (BMS/Energy Monitoring/HVAC controls/upgrade works)
Attend internal and external client/site meetings as necessary to determine initial scope of works and correct functionality during commissioning.
Work closely with the Research & Development department to incorporate new technologies and features into projects and report improvements back.
Assist with training and mentoring of engineers and apprentices.
Provide technical support for site engineers and customers as required.
Be a focal point for customers, helping to resolve any issues and develop our commitment to them.
Liaise with Customers and Project Engineers.
Gain, maintain and grow valuable client relationships.
Be prepared to work away from home when required.
Work overtime when required.




Skills & Experience

Hold a technical degree and/or have experience within the field of controls/BMS.
OR Have served a recognised apprenticeship in air conditioning/refrigeration and have good electrical/mechanical knowledge of HVAC, with a desire to learn the software side.
Experience with programmable controllers is desirable but not essential – the willingness and capability to learn is essential.
Carel 1tool software and pCO controllers.
Tridium Niagara 4 software and controllers.
Capable of understanding and designing control strategies.
Experience with HVAC applications and knowledge of cooling and heating systems.
Good electrical knowledge and capable of understanding electrical drawings.
Have basic knowledge of IT systems and communication networks.
Awareness of BMS and common communication protocols (Modbus, BACnet, TCP/IP)
Logical and methodical approach to problem solving using own initiative is a must.
Have good written & communication skills.
Team player.




Package Descriptions

Competitive Salary
7% Employer Pension contribution (min 1% employee)
Life assurance
25 days holiday + statutory days
Holiday Purchase scheme
Employee Assistance Programme
Airedale Rewards scheme – discounts on shopping/restaurants/cinema etc
Inhouse training school
Working for a UK based leading manufacturer
High quality of equipment and workwear




About Airedale

Formed in the UK in 1974, Airedale is a world leader in the delivery of innovative thermal management solutions in mission critical environments like data centres.

At our heart we’re a technology company, working with huge global colocation and hyperscale clients to design, build, install and optimise precision cooling systems that operate 24/7/365 in data centres all over the world. We are engineers, we are problem solvers and we are passionate about the role that air conditioning plays in an increasingly connected world. We’re also passionate about sustainability and we’re part of the Modine group, a global organization with fiscal 2022 revenues of $2.1 billion, who’s vision is to help engineer a cleaner, healthier world.




Prospective candidates must have proof that they have the right to work in the UK.




We kindly request that recruitment agencies do not contact us regarding the above position and we will only accept direct applications from interested candidates.




#LI-TS1

Title: Full Stack Developer
Description:
WRK digital are shortlisting for a Full Stack Developer to join a leading legal provider for insurers based on the outskirts of Leeds. Joining a small team, you will be working on existing and upcoming projects with the chance to develop your skillset.




You will be using the latest technologies to deliver scalable, quality cloud and high performance web applications to support the business in its Digital Strategy.




As Full Stack Developer, you will be responsible for:




Designing, developing and implementing front-end interfaces using angular and HTML
Optimizing applications for maximum speed and scalability.
Developing and deploying mobile applications.
Writing reusable, testable and efficient code to develop & maintain server-side logic using .Net.
Ensuring coding is conducted to best practice guidelines to ensure the application suite is built to the highest standard and maintained.
Ensuring technical feasibility of UI/UX designs.




As Full Stack Developer, you will have:




A minimum of 2 years experience using .Net, C# in a commercial environment.
Experience working with Angular/ Typescript
Knowledge of SQL Server, Entity framework and Azure
Experience working with agile methodologies
Strong communication skills and confidence to communicate with multiple stakeholders.




If this sounds of interest, please reach out to Hannah Walker at hannahw@wrkdigital.co.uk or click apply.

Title: Senior Cloud Engineer
Description:
Job Title/Req Number: Senior Cloud Engineer




Base Location: Leeds based (Hybrid – 3 days per week in office)




www.kpmgcareers.co.uk/experienced-professional/#LeBlender.OfficeLocations




As a result of the work that we do, we require applicants to hold or be capable of obtaining UK National Security Vetting, the requirements for which could include but not be limited to having resided in the UK for at least the past 5 years and being a UK national or dual UK national. Please note your application will not be taken forward if you cannot fulfil these requirements.




The KPMG Technical Engineering function is a cornerstone of our business. We do work that matters to our local business and communities – supporting Technical innovation and adoption of cutting edge solutions across the United Kingdom. This team will be responsible for delivering technology enabled outcomes for some of our clients most challenging business issues using modern and best in class engineering methodologies. We drive this transformation through the adoption of Cloud based technologies and have strategic relationships with Google, Microsoft among others. We have a technology agnostic view and select the right tool/language/cloud provider to achieve the best outcome for the client.

KPMG is one of the world's largest and most respected consultancy businesses, we've supported the UK through times of war and peace, prosperity and recession, political and regulatory upheaval. We've proudly stood beside the institutions and businesses which make the UK what it is.




Why Join KPMG Technology and Engineering as a Senior Cloud Engineer




This is a chance to be part of a new concept at KPMG. We are creating an onshore engineering team to gain access to a new segment of the technology market where there is opportunity for significant growth. We are looking for people to help establish the culture and ways of working of the team so we are well placed to make the most of this opportunity. We need help in curating and evolving this culture over time as it’s the most important element to the business.




What will you be doing?




Automate like your life depends on it
GTD – Get things done. Use the DevOps culture to bring capabilities together and ship projects
Obsessed with quality and measuring key metrics to drive improvement such as DORA
Deliver Technology solutions that are in alignment with business goals
Interest in researching and analysing new technologies and trends
Take technical responsibility for your code
Perform code reviews and pair-program with other team members




What will you need to do it?




A high percentage of work will require individuals to hold or be capable of obtaining UK National Security Vetting, the requirements for which could include but not be limited to having resided in the UK for at least the past 5 years and being a UK national or dual UK national.




Experience in designing and building infrastructure using a DevOps mindset in any of the main public cloud providers including AWS/Azure/GCP
Experience with distributed systems and ability to build secure cloud at scale
Experience using containerization technologies (Docker, Kubernetes etc)
Ability to manage key stakeholders, including clients on engagements with effective communication skills
Experience with IaC such as Terraform
Experience with CI/CD tooling (Github Actions, CircleCI etc)




Skills we’d love to see/Amazing Extras:




Experience building infrastructure testing within the pipeline for automated deployments
Knowledge of Database systems and models
Ability to use and also contribution to open-source technologies
Knowledge of test automation




To discuss this or wider Technology roles with our recruitment team, all you need to do is apply, create a profile, upload your CV and begin to make your mark with KPMG.




Our Locations:




We are open to talk to talent across the country but our core Tech hubs for this role are:

Glasgow
Leeds
London Canary Wharf
Manchester

This position will be based from our Leeds offices, with 3 days per week in the office

We can potentially facilitate flexible hours, and part-time options. If you have a need for flexibility, please register and discuss this with our team.




Find out more:




Within Tech and Engineering we have a range of divisions and specialisms. Click the links to find out more below:

Technology and Engineering at KPMG: www.kpmgcareers.co.uk/experienced-professional/technology-engineering/
ITs Her Future Women in Tech programme: www.kpmgcareers.co.uk/people-culture/it-s-her-future/
KPMG Workability and Disability confidence: www.kpmgcareers.co.uk/experienced-professional/applying-to-kpmg/need-support-let-us-know/

For any additional support in applying, please click the links to find out more:

Applying to KPMG: www.kpmgcareers.co.uk/experienced-professional/applying-to-kpmg/
Tips for interview: www.kpmgcareers.co.uk/experienced-professional/applying-to-kpmg/application-advice/
KPMG values: www.kpmgcareers.co.uk/experienced-professional/applying-to-kpmg/our-values/
KPMG Competencies: www.kpmgcareers.co.uk/experienced-professional/applying-to-kpmg/kpmg-competencies/
KPMG Locations and FAQ: www.kpmgcareers.co.uk/faq/?category=Experienced+professionals

Title: Senior Engineer
Description:
Empower Educators, Shape the Future: Senior Node.js Developer with AWS Expertise




Join our award-winning, global SaaS client and empower educators to transform the lives of millions of students worldwide. They're on a mission to impact over 13 million students in 25,000 schools across 200 countries!




Fueled by a recent £100m+ investment, we're helping the team build a cutting-edge development team. Be the backend expert they need to tackle exciting challenges during a massive AWS migration project.




Here's your chance to:




Leverage your Node.js and TypeScript expertise to conquer backend and data hurdles during the AWS migration.
Collaborate with frontend devs to create user experiences that inspire.
Champion DevOps best practices - CI/CD, IaC (Terraform, CloudFormation) are your playground.
Design and implement event-driven architectures and microservices like a pro.




We're looking for a passionate leader who:




Has a proven track record of successfully deploying to AWS.
Thrives in a fast-paced, innovation-driven environment.
Is a problem-solving rockstar with a knack for impactful results using AWS and TypeScript.
Has experience building applications used by millions.
Demonstrates leadership qualities across multiple projects.




This is more than a job; it's a chance to make a real difference. Join a team that's transforming education on a global scale. Let's build something amazing together!




Bonus points for:




A passion for education technology.
A willingness to learn and collaborate across the tech stack.




Salary: £65,000 - £75,000 (DOE) | Once a month in Leeds offices




Ready to make a lasting impact? Apply today!

HTML:
Empower Educators, Shape the Future: Senior Node.js Developer with AWS Expertise


Join our award-winning, global SaaS client and empower educators to transform the lives of millions of students worldwide. They're on a mission to impact over 13 million students in 25,000 schools across 200 countries!


Fueled by a recent £100m+ investment, we're helping the team build a cutting-edge development team. Be the backend expert they need to tackle exciting challenges during a massive AWS migration project.


Here's your chance to:


  • Leverage your Node.js and TypeScript expertise to conquer backend and data hurdles during the AWS migration.
  • Collaborate with frontend devs to create user experiences that inspire.
  • Champion DevOps best practices - CI/CD, IaC (Terraform, CloudFormation) are your playground.
  • Design and implement event-driven architectures and microservices like a pro.


We're looking for a passionate leader who:


  • Has a proven track record of successfully deploying to AWS.
  • Thrives in a fast-paced, innovation-driven environment.
  • Is a problem-solving rockstar with a knack for impactful results using AWS and TypeScript.
  • Has experience building applications used by millions.
  • Demonstrates leadership qualities across multiple projects.


This is more than a job; it's a chance to make a real difference. Join a team that's transforming education on a global scale. Let's build something amazing together!


Bonus points for:


  • A passion for education technology.
  • A willingness to learn and collaborate across the tech stack.


Salary: £65,000 - £75,000 (DOE) | Once a month in Leeds offices


Ready to make a lasting impact? Apply today!

Title: Building Management Systems Engineer
Description:
We know that climate change is one of the biggest challenges the world faces. We work hard to help our customers in delivering their ambitions towards Net Zero coupled with long term cost reduction and have been for over 10 years now. We’re passionate about sustainability and making changes to the built environment to help our customers reduce their energy consumption and ultimately their carbon emissions; by renewing their buildings infrastructure; saving on operating costs and improving the efficiency of their buildings.




Our clients include the NHS, Universities, local authorities, and the private sector, and we’re growing all the time!




We are proud to have a diverse and inclusive ethos. We want to attract a range of talented individuals to join our team. Our success is only possible because of our outstanding team and we’re looking to build on our strong foundations.




We remove bias and barriers for our people and our candidates. We are an Equal Opportunities Employer and very proud of our already diverse workforce. As an equal opportunities’ employer, we support and encourage you to be, and bring your authentic self to work.




As a BMS Project Engineer, you will have proven experience working on all stages of the project from design and completion of budgetary and time sensitive milestones through to handover. You will be responsible for the design, specification, costing and project management of BMS projects including major upgrades and refurbishment works.




This includes:




What you will be working on...




Solution design and specification: Overseeing the auditing, surveys and BMS design phases for all new projects, ensuring a compliant and accurate design is costed and proposed. Checking the project packages to ensure that BMS scope gaps are identified and costed.
Client management: Working with and for the technical and work winning teams.
Subcontractor management: Managing and coordinating all BMS sub-contractor and third-party activity, to ensure accurate and competitive designs and proposals are procured to aid work winning tenders and proposals.
Project and delivery support: Ensuring the designs and project plans are delivered and/or handed over to the Project Management teams to ensure smooth delivery on forecast, plan and budgets. The role may involve direct delivery tasks and activities (Project Management, subcontractor documentation review, commissioning, witnessing and handover) as and where required.
Managing (or co-ordination of) the site activities required as part of the BMS surveys, audits and data gathering.
Liaising with the client (internal and external) and attending site/client meetings.
Liaising with mechanical, electrical, and energy engineering consultants and colleagues.
Assisting project teams to ensure that projects are safely completed on time, budget and scope (handover completed and O&Ms issued).
Leading on day-to-day management of the controls design and specification.
Assisting work winning teams with bids and project development requiring controls
Design Stage
Own the delivery of the controls design in accordance with the design management procedures, which may include the following key requirements:

§ Manage, plan and co-ordinate all site surveys, audits and data gathering activities to allow a BMS design and specification to be written.

§ Be the interface with internal or 3rd party MEP designers to understand what schemes are being developed and agree descriptions of operation, points schedules, cable sizing for power supplies and MCP specification and include all this detail in the specification.

§ Ensure all site activities are planned with Risk Assessments and Method Statements approved before site mobilisation.

§ Review all sub-contractor/supplier drawings and technical submittals for compliance, build and commissioning in line with Regulations and standards including CIBSE and BSRIA codes of practice as required.

§ Competitive pricing processes to obtain best costs for design.

Tendering Stage
Provision of a clearly defined specification document to cover and detail all BMS design.
Clear and compliant proposals and business cases for all design and tenders.
Ongoing and regular reviews with technical teams – from conception to award of the project.
Assist project commercial team with evaluation of the tenders associated with the works.
Project Planning and Delivery Stage
Own the delivery of the controls works in accordance with Breathe’s project management procedures which may include the following key requirements:
Manage, plan and co-ordinate all control works to ensure that the controls packages are completed to programme and within budget
Be the interface between internal or 3rd party MEP designers, subcontractors and the client to ensure that all design changes and queries are captured and implemented.
Ensure all site activities are planned with Risk Assessments and Method Statements approved before site activities
Review all sub-contractor/supplier drawings and technical submittals for compliance, build and commissioning in line with Regulations and standards including CIBSE and BSRIA codes of practice as required.
Witness and accept the operation and performance of the control system before offering to the client for approval.
Liaise with the client and their representatives to ensure that network communications are provided in accordance with their IT team




The above list is not exhaustive and can change due to business requirements.




The skills and experience you need...




Essential

Demonstrable experience working on controls projects in a multi-disciplinary project team.
Experience in client-facing roles and managing subcontractors.
Ability and demonstrable experience in:
Providing costed controls design and specifications with tendering knowledge
Commercial and financial management
Control networks and remote communications
Commissioning and/or maintaining control systems
Working safely with electrical systems and control panels
Knowledge and understanding of relevant legislation, approved and industrial codes of practice, standards and guidance.
Working to company H&S and staff management policies and procedures
Experience working under CDM regulations.
Knowledge and experience of integrating different systems and protocols into a common head end.
Experience working with electrical safety regulations.

Desirable

Experience of delivering projects in both the public and private sectors, preferably (but not limited to) industrial, NHS, Government and Local Authority environments.
Knowledge and experience of multiple control systems.
A thorough working knowledge or ability to produce controls design documentation, such as functional design specifications, alarm and trips matrices, cause and effect matrices, points lists and setpoint lists.
A thorough working knowledge or ability to produce controls commissioning documentation, such as commissioning plans, and inspection and testing plans.
Knowledge of modern sources of energy, such as heat pumps, combined heat and power units and boilers for LTHW, MTHW and steam




So, what's in it for you?




Firstly, you get to join a fantastic, friendly, forward-thinking team of people, who will welcome you and are passionate about the work that we do.




We also offer a wide range of benefits and rewards;




Flexible working hours (including 13.30 finish every Friday) with offices based at London and Leeds and the ability to work from home
Our offices are based close to public transport networks, enabling you to work from a variety of locations that are easily accessible
A competitive salary package
A discretionary Annual Bonus Scheme – depended on role and achievement of certain KPI’S
We pay for professional memberships relevant to your role and invest in our people’s professional development
Pension Scheme
BUPA single membership
Health cash back plan where you can claim back costs such as dental, optical, and medical
Income Protection
Free life assurance
25 Days Holiday PLUS Bank holidays
Cycle to work scheme
An electric vehicle scheme – where we help you lease an electric vehicle for a fixed monthly cost.
Show more

Title: Senior Software Engineer - C#/.Net
Description:
Job Title: Senior Software Engineer - C#/.Net)




Base Location: Leeds based (Hybrid – 3 days per week in office)




kpmg88careers.co.uk/experienced-professional/#LeBlender.OfficeLocations




As a result of the work that we do, we require applicants to hold or be capable of obtaining UK National Security Vetting, the requirements for which could include but not be limited to having resided in the UK for at least the past 5 years and being a UK national or dual UK national. Please note your application will not be taken forward if you cannot fulfil these requirements.




The KPMG Technical Engineering function is a cornerstone of our business. We do work that matters to our local business and communities – supporting technical innovation and adoption of cutting edge solutions across the United Kingdom. This team will be responsible for delivering technology enabled outcomes for some of our clients most challenging business issues using modern and best in class engineering methodologies. We drive this transformation through the adoption of Cloud based technologies and have strategic relationships with Google, Microsoft among others. We have a technology agnostic view and select the right tool/language/cloud provider to achieve the best outcome for the client.




KPMG is one of the world's largest and most respected consultancy businesses, we've supported the UK through times of war and peace, prosperity and recession, political and regulatory upheaval. We've proudly stood beside the institutions and businesses which make the UK what it is.







Why Join KPMG Technology and Engineering as a Senior Software Engineer – C#/.Net




This is an opportunity for significant growth, but with a start-up feel and mentality. In this role you will have the chance to be part of a new concept at KPMG. We are creating an onshore engineering team to gain access to a new segment of the technology market where there is opportunity for significant growth. We are looking for people to help establish the culture and ways of working of the team so we are well placed to make the most of this opportunity. We need help in curating and evolving this culture over time as it’s the most important element to the business.







What will you be doing




This role will be to build technology enabled outcomes for some of our clients most challenging business issues using modern and best in class engineering methodologies
Be enthusiastic and inquisitive about new technology with a desire to continuously improve software development practices
Be proactive in researching and analysing new technologies and trends
Share your views and experiences into the team and add another dimension to our solutions
Pair-program with other team members
Perform code reviews




What will you need to do it?







A high percentage of work will require individuals to hold or be capable of obtaining UK National Security Vetting, the requirements for which could include but not be limited to having resided in the UK for at least the past 5 years and being a UK national or dual UK national.




Experience in C# / .Net, full-stack experience preferred.
Experience of building distributed systems and secure products at scale.
Experience using containerization technologies (Docker, Kubernetes etc)
Experience with RESTful APIs and microservices best practices.
Extensive experience with CI/CD tooling (Github Actions, CircleCI etc)
Experience working with cloud platforms such as AWS, Azure and GCP.







Skills we’d love to see/Amazing Extras:




Solution development and delivery into at least one cloud platform (AWS, Azure, GCP)
Knowledge of Database systems and models.
Ability to use wide variety of open-source technologies.
Experience with logging/monitoring tools (DataDog, StackDriver, Prometheus etc),
Knowledge of test automation frameworks.




To discuss this or wider Technology roles with our recruitment team, all you need to do is apply, create a profile, upload your CV and begin to make your mark with KPMG.




Our Locations:




We are open to talk to talent across the country but our core Tech hubs for this role are:

Glasgow
Leeds
London Canary Wharf
Manchester




This position will be based from our Leeds offices, with 3 days per week in the office

We can potentially facilitate flexible hours, and part-time options. If you have a need for flexibility, please register and discuss this with our team.







Find out more:




Within Tech and Engineering we have a range of divisions and specialisms. Click the links to find out more below:

Technology and Engineering at KPMG: www.kpmgcareers.co.uk/experienced-professional/technology-engineering/
ITs Her Future Women in Tech programme: www.kpmgcareers.co.uk/people-culture/it-s-her-future/
KPMG Workability and Disability confidence: www.kpmgcareers.co.uk/experienced-professional/applying-to-kpmg/need-support-let-us-know/
any additional support in applying, please click the links to find out more:
Applying to KPMG: www.kpmgcareers.co.uk/experienced-professional/applying-to-kpmg/
Tips for interview: www.kpmgcareers.co.uk/experienced-professional/applying-to-kpmg/application-advice/
KPMG values: www.kpmgcareers.co.uk/experienced-professional/applying-to-kpmg/our-values/
KPMG Competencies: www.kpmgcareers.co.uk/experienced-professional/applying-to-kpmg/kpmg-competencies/
KPMG Locations and FAQ: www.kpmgcareers.co.uk/faq/?category=Experienced+professionals

Title: Cloud Infrastructure Engineer
Description:
Job Title: Cloud Infrastructure Engineer

Location: Leeds

Working Model: Remote (required to go in to Leeds office twice a month)

Salary: up to £65,000

Reporting to: Infrastructure Team Lead




NRG is thrilled to announce we are working alongside a leading Utility organization in their search for a Cloud Infrastructure Engineer. This is an exciting time to join our client during a dynamic period of growth as they as they enhance their core infrastructure.




Role Overview:




Reporting to the Infrastructure Team Lead, you will support cloud technologies and manage project delivery alongside internal and external support vendors across various technologies.




You will efficiently and professionally resolve incidents and requests in accordance with service level agreements. Your primary responsibility is the delivery of cloud services for our client’s network and server environments. The ideal candidate should be technically adept, with experience in designing and implementing cloud solutions.




This role provides the freedom to explore and implement optimal solutions for the organisation, while allowing you to enhance your technical skills by working with and configuring complex products and technologies.




Our client offer opportunities for growth and advancement within the company through both internal and external training programs.




Key Responsibilities and Accountabilities:




Deliver high-quality IT support and manage project delivery effectively.
Configure and deploy cloud services, third-party tools, and integrations.
Provide technical consultation on existing and proposed cloud services.
Participate in planning and scoping for highly available cloud solutions.
Assist the Service Desk team with the support of existing cloud services and infrastructure as needed.
Maintain and create essential technical documentation.
Embrace a DevOps culture and stay updated with the latest industry cloud offerings.




Job Requirements:




Manage infrastructure and provide third-line support, resolving issues swiftly and efficiently.
Proficiency with core AWS services, including EC2, Storage, IAM, SNS, Lambda, Databases, Route 53, CloudWatch, CloudTrail, API Gateways, and Systems Manager.
Experience in deploying infrastructure as code.
Oversee and sustain the cloud infrastructure to ensure optimal performance and efficiency.
Experience in deploying and maintaining code pipelines.
Capability to understand and manage AWS VPC network roles, such as Transit Gateways, Direct Connect, VPNs, ACLs, NACLs, Peering, and Route Tables.
Knowledge of DevOps principles, including continuous delivery and continuous integration.
Experience in configuring and maintaining server OS systems.
Familiarity with AWS billing and management.
Experience in performing root cause analysis to identify and resolve issues.
Exposure to infrastructure project delivery.
Familiarity of high availability, backup technologies, RTO, and RPO.
Strong understanding of AWS security best practices
Participation in an after-hours on-call rotation (1 in 4 weeks)




Desirables:




ITIL practices and knowledge of change control.
Understanding of networking topologies, such as switching, VLANs, routing, remote access, and various switching layers.
Familiarity with additional AWS services such as IoT, Machine Learning, auto-scaling, and containerization.
Experience with cloud automation tools like Chef, Puppet, Ansible, and JSON.
Experience with FortiGate routers and firewalls.
Relevant certifications, including:
AWS Certified Solutions Architect – Associate Level
AWS Certified SysOps Administrator – Associate Level
AWS Certified Developer – Associate Level
ITIL certification.




For more information or to apply, click Apply Now and a member of our team will be in touch.

Show more

Desirables:


  • ITIL practices and knowledge of change control.
  • Understanding of networking topologies, such as switching, VLANs, routing, remote access, and various switching layers.
  • Familiarity with additional AWS services such as IoT, Machine Learning, auto-scaling, and containerization.
  • Experience with cloud automation tools like Chef, Puppet, Ansible, and JSON.
  • Experience with FortiGate routers and firewalls.
  • Relevant certifications, including:
  • AWS Certified Solutions Architect – Associate Level
  • AWS Certified SysOps Administrator – Associate Level
  • AWS Certified Developer – Associate Level
  • ITIL certification.


For more information or to apply, click Apply Now and a member of our team will be in touch.

Title: Software Engineer
Description:
Want to deliver tech with purpose, with people who care?




Join us in our mission to create solutions that help keep children safe online.




Who we are?

Headquartered in Perth, Australia, Qoria is an ASX listed global leader in child digital safety technology and services. We are a purpose driven business, operating under the ‘Linewize’ brand in North America and Asia Pacific, under the ‘Smoothwall’ brand in the UK, and under the ‘Qoria’ brand in EMEA. Our solutions are utilized by schools, school districts and their parental communities to protect children from seeing harmful content online, to identify children at risk based on their digital behaviors and to ensure teachers maintain focus and safe learning in the digital classroom. 27k schools and 6 million parents depend on our solutions to keep 22 million children safe in 180 countries around the world.




What’s the opportunity?

A Software Engineer owns the day-to-day trade off between quality, time-to-build and cost-to-own. They work in close conjunction with an Engineering Manager and other engineers, together ensuring that their changes are estimated accurately, delivered to specification, and have high quality and low cost of ownership. The question they must continually ask themselves is “Am I making the right engineering trade-offs for this component?”




Here's how you'll do it:




Deliver quality work: The successful candidate will deliver work we are all proud of. Code is written to a high standard, and follows the conventions set by the team. Important aspects include, in consultation with their manager and other engineers (and especially QA Engineers), software that is easily testable and actually tested, and through that work correct and reliable. Depending on context, quality might include an emphasis on maintainability, readability, extensibility, generality, scalability and cost of ownership.




Fit-for-purpose Design: supported by their manager and peers, the successful candidate will spend time mindfully designing software that meets the specification and coheres with other parts of the system. Design is detailed enough to estimate work. It is based on an understanding of impacts on customers and other components, and includes explicit identification of and mitigations for risks (e.g. privacy, security, dependencies).




Professional Growth: the baseload work of Software Engineers is of course the actual delivery of software. They should be a little better tomorrow than they are today. They therefore are responsible for identifying and critically evaluating tools, techniques, trends and patterns, and the intentional application of them that most benefits the component being delivered. As software engineers grow within the role, they are expected to have a positive influence on the professional growth of others and a positive impact on the team.




What you'll bring:

At least 2 years experience in a software engineering or similar role
Experience of Go as your main programming language
Bachelor's degree or equivalent vocational experience




Why choose sSmoothwall by Qoria:

In this role, you can expect:

Employee Share Scheme
Zone Out Days
Tech Allowance
.... and much more




More importantly, you’ll:

Deliver tech with purpose...

As a Software Engineer here, your work truly matters. Your skills, knowledge and ideas will all help children stay safe online. It feels good to do good.

With people who care...

Our Software Engineers are amazing! They’re also amazingly supportive. We all take ownership of our work, end to end. And at the same time, we really care about growing and winning together.

Through work that you love...

You’ll get to work on technology and data scaling challenges for a global customer base. And you'll be exposed to modern technologies and processes, in a fast-paced and supportive learning environment.

And a career that you own...

This role offers so many opportunities to expand your skills and grow your career. You’ll get to attend local software conferences, paid for by us. And as you step up and take ownership to make things happen, you’ll carve out an incredible career.




What’s our technology stack?

The tech stack you’ll be using will depend on the team you’re working with. But the range of technologies we use means there are always opportunities for further growth and development.

Our platform is predominantly cloud-based (GCP), and we have a rich tapestry of architectural components and processes including:

RESTful backend services (Go, Python, Java)
Client-side static apps (React)
Fit-for-purpose filtering clients deployed across laptops, mobiles, and tablets (Go, Java, C/C++)
Deployment and orchestration via Terraform, Docker, Kubernetes, Cloud Run
Distributed version control via Github and CI/CD via Github actions, Argo and CodeFresh. We follow trunk-based development and GitOps
BigTable, BigQuery, Dataflow, Pub/Sub, PostgreSQL, Redis, Memcached, CockroachDB




We’d love you to apply, even if you don’t have experience with our entire tech stack. We’re pro-learning, good engineering and coding paradigms, rather than specific tools.




Shortlisting will commence immediately.

Title: Software Engineer, Fullstack DevOps
Description:
Analog Devices, Inc. (NASDAQ: ADI) is a global semiconductor leader that bridges the physical and digital worlds to enable breakthroughs at the Intelligent Edge. ADI combines analog, digital, and software technologies into solutions that help drive advancements in digitized factories, mobility, and digital healthcare, combat climate change, and reliably connect humans and the world. With revenue of more than $12 billion in FY22 and approximately 25,000 people globally working alongside 125,000 global customers, ADI ensures today’s innovators stay Ahead of What’s Possible.

Job: Senior Engineer, Software Infrastructure

Job Description

Analog Devices Inc's (ADI), Software Engineering and Solutions (SES) Platform Engineering team is seeking an enthusiastic and versatile software engineer passionate about creating innovative and high-quality software products that allow our customers to improve time to market. The Platform Engineering team works across the organization to provide tools and infrastructure to streamline the development, release, and deployment of software and improve the developer experience by providing capabilities to increase developer productivity and reduce development overhead.

Qualifications:

The ideal candidate will hold a Computer Science Degree. Additionally, they will have demonstrated:


Minimum of 5 years' experience in DevOps, including proficiency in CI/CD methodologies and Infrastructure as Code.
Proficient in Git and GitHub workflows, with experience contributing to open-source projects on GitHub.
Skilled in programming and scripting with languages such as Python, JavaScript, Java, Groovy, or Rust.
Demonstrated experience in software development across multiple operating systems: Windows, Linux, and macOS.
Familiarity with development tools, notably Visual Studio Code.
Practical experience with containerization technologies, specifically Docker.
Hands-on experience with cloud platforms like AWS, Azure, or GCP.
Strong interest in web technologies, including JavaScript, Node.js, React, and familiarity with testing frameworks.
Exposure to C/C++ and experience in embedded systems development.
Proven ability to thrive in an Agile software development setting.
A commitment to quality and a thorough understanding of process improvement.
Excellent team collaboration skills, with the ability to also work independently in a supportive environment.
But most importantly, enthusiasm, collaboration, and a solid work ethic are valued more than any skill!


Responsibilities:


Develop innovative tools, infrastructure, and systems to enhance software development at ADI.
Collaborate closely with software developers to automate and refine the development and release workflows.
Partner with software development teams to help them follow established best practices and processes.
Focus on enhancing the developer experience through streamlined workflows and efficient practices.
Deliver outstanding support to both internal and external customers.
Work to meet clearly defined schedules as part of a distributed team working with many amazing employees all over the world.


For positions requiring access to technical data, Analog Devices, Inc. may have to obtain export licensing approval from the U.S. Department of Commerce - Bureau of Industry and Security and/or the U.S. Department of State - Directorate of Defense Trade Controls. As such, applicants for this position – except US Citizens, US Permanent Residents, and protected individuals as defined by 8 U.S.C. 1324b(a)(3) – may have to go through an export licensing review process.

Analog Devices is an equal opportunity employer. We foster a culture where everyone has an opportunity to succeed regardless of their race, color, religion, age, ancestry, national origin, social or ethnic origin, sex, sexual orientation, gender, gender identity, gender expression, marital status, pregnancy, parental status, disability, medical condition, genetic information, military or veteran status, union membership, and political affiliation, or any other legally protected group.

Job Req Type: Experienced

Required Travel: Yes, 10% of the time

Shift Type: 1st Shift/Days

Title: Senior Software Engineer
Description:
Enjoy the speed and dynamic nature of Startups.




Highly experienced with NodeJS & TypeScript?




ADA is exclusively partnered with an emerging startup that has built its security compliance tool.

Their easy-to-use tool automates tasks, streamlines processes, simplifies workflows, and keeps up with the latest regulations and standards.




They’re looking to onboard a Lead Engineer experienced in Node/TypeScript/GCP to play a fundamental role in developing and scaling their greenfield product.




Role:




• Senior Developer (NodeJS)

• £75k DOE

• Hybrid (Manchester – twice a week in the office)

• Professional development, social events, progression




You will have complete autonomy and ownership of product development and will be working very closely with the Head of Tech, mentoring one Developer. Ideally, you’ll have experience in a start-up environment previously and enjoy the fast-paced nature of this. You’ll value simplicity and best practice - but don’t let perfection get in the way of progress.




You’ll need to be passionate about building awesome stuff and not afraid to roll up your sleeves. Whilst you are predominately hands-on, you can expect to dive into everything from architecture, and bug fixes to big-picture strategy sessions.




Tech:




• Restful APIs with NodeJS / NestJs

• GCP/AWS

• Postgres

• Release Management

• Swagger Documentation

• Atlassian Jira etc

• Google APIs

• Agile

• Github




Requirements of the Role




• Knowledgeable with the fundamentals of coding.

• Know NodeJs like the back of your hand.

• Atleast one DB type: Postgres, Mysql and MongoDB.

• You’ve played an active part in the planning and delivery one or many integrations.

• You enjoy complex problem solving.

• You don’t see technical planning as a chore

• You welcome healthy technical debate




Benefits:




• £75k DOE

• Hybrid Remote working

• Flexible working hours

• True Start-up Culture

• Training Budget

• Holiday/Pension




Company Values:




• We move fast

• We take ownership

• We are solution focussed

• We look after each other

• We refuse to lose




We understand that job adverts only give a snapshot of the role, so we know you will have plenty of questions.




Rest assured, we will share everything from the full job description, location, salary, benefits, and more on our initial briefing call.




You can also contact me at sam.goode@adameher.com / 07780393566
